Summary Heading: Over all good place to be
Summary: I’ve stayed here countless times and I’ve really enjoyed my stay however the only problems I’ve had were with some of the house keepers, I left a designer bag in a room when I checked out and house keeping haven’t been diligent in getting it back to me all they keep saying is that they’ll call me back but that hasn’t happened either. Over all good place just don’t trust housekeepers, the front desk staff is very hospitable good people tho
Room tip: Lots of parking in front and back.
Manager Response: Hi Smol M,   Thank you for taking the time to share your review and for always choosing to stay with us. We are glad to know that our front desk was great, however, I do regret that you faced issues during your stay. Our primary goal is to provide all guests with an enjoyable experience and it is troubling to know that you faced such an unusual experience. We take this quite highly and your feedback will be shared with management so that appropriate steps can be taken. Thank you again for taking the time for sharing this experience and for your valuable business.

Summary: Do yourself a favor and book anywhere else. I only used my debit card to pay for the room. My husband paid for everything else. When we got back home my debit card info was stolen and there was fraudulent activity on my card so I had to close it. The outlets didn't work. It was dirty. We found a bunch of trash under the bed. I pulled out the sofa bed and there were dirty sheets on it. It was bad. I'm not a picky person nor do I complain just to complain or write reviews but that's how terrible this was. I honestly just felt like I should warn people.
Manager Response: Dear cynthias0409,   I am so sorry to hear that your most recent stay with us did not meet your expectations. Our primary goal is to provide all guests with an enjoyable experience and it is troubling to know that you faced such an unusual experience.   Our housekeeping staff is held to a very high standard and we appreciate that you've informed us of a need to address housekeeping policies and procedures. We also appreciate your time in pointing out the facilities in most need of attention as we work towards updating and improving upon our accommodations.   We take this quite highly and your feedback will be shared with management so that appropriate steps can be taken. Thank you again for taking the time for sharing this experience and for your valuable business.

Summary: When booking we were told check in is at 4:00.  We arrived at 3:45 and was told they had not started our room yet and to expect ab hour wait.  We had planned our time carefully so this was an in convince.  We also chose this hotel because it advertised having a pool table but they no longer have one.  Seems like they need to be careful what they advertise/promise and that they don’t like up to what they claim.    Lobby seems clean.  Service counter seems kind but no willing to compensate for any inconvenience.
Manager Response: Dear danatraveler2022,   Thank you for your comprehensive review detailing your recent stay with us. We are very disappointed to learn of your experience at our hotel, and we apologize for the many issues that you encountered. We have reviewed all of your comments as a management team, and each department head will formulate a plan to ensure that the risk of such issues occurring again are minimized. We apologize sincerely for not providing you with a better stay.

Summary Heading: Worst quality Inn I ever stayed in
Summary: The place is near knotts but the room it’s not practical no drawers for clothing no hand towels nowhere to get ice, dirty microwave stained towels you pay for what you get, refrigerator doesn’t get cold not a nice place to stay in.
Manager Response: Dear Helen S,   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback after your recent stay with us. It is our goal to make sure each guest enjoys a welcoming and comfortable experience, and it saddens us to hear that your time with us did not meet your expectations or our standards, especially with the condition of your room and the cleanliness. We apologize for the issue you encountered with the service you received, and we will address your concerns with our team. It would be wonderful to see you again so we can make sure you enjoy the excellent visit you deserve.

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights because the bad reviews I read all had to do with them remodeling I called and asked them to put me in a remodeled room and was told it should be almost done when I came. There version of remodeling was a new mattress which was comfortable and painting (in bathroom going behind sink cabinet had a large patch job which was not painted). All the furniture was old with lots of wear on it. They took out the large bathroom sink counters and put in very small free standing vanity sink so there is no place to put stuff. The shower head is nice and high but there was no shelf to put your soap and shampoo/conditioner. I balance the soap on top of the shower frame (closing the toilet in case it fell) and put shampoo bottle on top of the towel on the towel bar. The
Room tip: Call ahead and ask to reserve a room NOT facing Beach Blvd to mininize noise at night.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca P,  Thank you for completing the survey regarding your recent stay at our property.  Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  Thank you again for taking the time to complete the survey. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.

Summary: My family and I booked two non-smoking room Choice Rewards. When we get there, the rooms smelled funky and awful. We talked to the receptionist and asked if there are other rooms better. She assigned us to a newer remodeled rooms but the chairs are ripped and the side tables are broken. In short, the room appliances are old. We went back to the receptionist and she cancelled our reservation. She said that she will email my refund confirmation but until now there is no refund and no follow up from the hotel management. Oh by the way, they are only good in responding to your Credit Card Dispute and say that they have cancellation policy which I never received.
Manager Response: Dear kelutzg,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I am shocked to hear about the situations you encountered and would like to deeply apologize. I also would like to ensure you that comments like yours are not taken lightly and will be addressed immediately with our entire team especially with the condition of the hotel and the cleanliness at that time. The description of your stay is highly unusual and does not represent the level of high standards we all aim to achieve. We do hope you allow us another opportunity on a future stay to show you, how we used your overall comments to improve.

Summary: We made our reservations through Priceline with our flight. Photos were nice. Upon arrival to our room we were greeted by bugs on the floor, holes in the walls, and only 1 of the two lights in the bed area works. The “curtains” are sheer. I’m certain several people in the pool right outside the room have seen everything. Despite their attempt to fix the walls, the wrong color paint may actually be worse than holes. Only 1 outlet works. I could go on, but you get the idea. I’m all for budget, but this is pushing even my boundaries.
Manager Response: Dear allisonl786,  Thank you for letting us know about the inconveniences that you encountered during your recent stay at our hotel. Please accept our sincerest apologies about the state of your room upon your arrival. It is not like us to deliver poor accommodations and we will work our hardest to get back to the standard we are known for.   Steps shall be taken to ensure no other guests will experience the same. Rest assured that it will never happen again as we will provide a better stay to our guests. Thank you and I am hoping that you can give us another chance to prove our service to you again.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel and Service - Do NOT Stay There!
Summary: My stay in June was absolutely awful.  I made two reservations through Expedia and checked in accordingly.  The hotel put me in a non-renovated room the first night and it was barely stayable. If I hadn't arrived at almost midnight with my family, I would have demanded another room or went to find a better hotel.  Their non-renovated rooms have broken showers, shower heads, sinks don't drain, the gap under the door lets bugs in, there was clearly dirt and mold that had not yet been cleaned or taken care of, places on the walls where they patched but didn't paint.  Additionally they do not clean or change their linnen. The bedding had what appeared to be blood or food stains.  The smoke detector was broken. The AC was stuck in one position cause the knobs were broken. The GM
Room tip: The only good about this hotel is location to Knotts.
Manager Response: Dear Trip254523,  Thank you for sharing your experience, and I am so sorry to learn that we failed to meet your expectations of quality service and accommodations. We take the value on your report regarding the condition of the hotel and the cleanliness during your stayl. We will act on these complaints seriously and will fix all problems as soon as possible. We take your business very seriously and assure you that management has taken all the steps to make sure that all the rooms are clean and our ultimate goal is to make sure each guest has a comfortable stay. Again, thank you for your time and feedback. We sincerely hope you will give us another chance to provide you with superior service and accommodations on your next visit.

Summary: I didn’t have a lot of expectations coming here but my experience wasn’t very great. Don’t expect free breakfast during COVID cause there’s no free breakfast. The hotel room looked nice and hotel staff was nice but I got a room located right next to the pool. The people next door were outside by the pool until 12:30. I could hear laughing and yelling and it just wasn’t peaceful.

I have to agree this motel not hotel is pretty gross and run down. I too found toe nail clippings on the carpet and mold in the bathroom.  The outlets can’t be up to code and need to be updated. There was a booger on the bathroom wall along with what looked like the start of mold growing from the moisture that could be easily cleaned. FYI there is no elevator and the stairs are made of stone which gets very slippery in the rain. I don’t recommend staying here. The office chair is a joke. Just throw it away and don’t have one in the room if you can’t replace it.

The photos this hotel provides are very misleading. Our room had toe nail clippings on the carpet, grey-dirty walls, leaky taps, peeling paint and dust bunnies everywhere. Walls are thin. Road noise was inescapable. Air conditioning is loud. Free breakfast ran out both mornings that we stayed. Toaster was broken. Overall, it was gross.

The pictures don’t look like the place at all,  maybe they were taken when it was new.  We reserved 2 rooms a family suite and a king with a double pull out.  Both rooms were grossly dirty.  If I walked in bare feet the carpet was so dirty my feet turned black.  The rooms were poorly lit and filthy.   We spoke with management as we wanted to get our money back and stay somewhere else.  They refused and the didn’t make appropriate attempts to resolve the issues or compensate for them although they did  acknowledge that it was dirty.  We stayed 6 nights.  (. Not by choice only because they wouldn't give us our money back). During the whole time we were there and having them aware of the issues they still did not attempt to clean the room. There were Cheerios on the floor,  hair

We stayed here for 4 nights during our Disneyland vacation. Like mosy of the other reviews, you get what you pay for. We had a suite with 2 queen beds and a full (?). I think it would make more sense to have 1 queen (usually parents) fulls for kids. The room was old and in need of some love. It really needs a new coat of paint and the door needs replacing. The tub was really leaking on our arrival, but was fixed quickly. The sink backed up the next day but also quickly fixed. I'm pretty sure the maintenance person brought a kid with them, because there was a toy left behind. The room needs a REALLY good deep cleaning. There was stuff under the bed that I am sure has been there for a while. It does has a microwave and fridge which was nice. We did use the hot tub (not very hot)

The location was great. Quick drive to Knots Berry, beautiful street. Close to Disney Land and beaches. Lots of shopping and dining close by. The layout is quite vast. Therefore when your room is on the farthest end of the complex it is quite a walk to the pool/breakfast area. Breakfast was not great. Constantly running out of food with no one refilling in a timely manner or cleaning up overflowing garbages and spilled messes. Zero secure feeling. Anyone can walk into the pool area and therefore into breakfast. Did not allow my children to go on their own. Think we would find a different place to stay in the area if we went again.

This hotel deserves 0 stars. It was one of the most nasties hotels I have ever stayed in. There were used q-tips on the garbage and a shirt on a chair someone left.  Did they give us a used room!!?? When I complained they just apologized and stared at me like I had no reason to complain.   I will never stay at this hotel or another quality inn again!

Summary Heading: You Do Get What You Pay For, and then a little less.
Summary: This is one of those hotels that you get what you pay for.  Pros: *Location to Knott's Berry Farm and area restaurants *Cheap *Linens and sheets clean  Cons: *Extreme disrepair *Uncaring staff *Thin walls *Breakfast is not worth it *Carpets and furniture extremely worn and dirty  It is one of the cheapest hotel options in the area and there is definitely a reason for that. The entire place needs to be updated and is in extremely poor condition. The sheets and towels were clean, but the floors looked awful. We tried to keep our shoes on as much as possible and wore socks the entire time. It looks like they recently upgraded the bathroom counter, but they definitely used the lowest bidder because everything was cockeye, not a big deal, just shows the laziness that you can see

The only two advantages of this property are its relatively cheaper price compared to other hotels in the area and the proximity to Disneyland Park in Anaheim. Which were the reasons why I booked a suite room which was supposed to consist of one bedroom and multiple bathrooms (I'd expect two bathrooms since they mentioned 'multiple') for four of us. We did indeed get a one bedroom suite but it had only one bathroom. I called up the reception but was told that they did not have any other options available and someone from the management would call me back the next day to address the issue. No one did. The suite room, while spacious, is towards the very back of the property and it is a good 5 minute walk from the front desk area. The beds were small and uncomfortable. The bedroom

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: The place is a bargain considering the location and I fully expect what you pay for, but here they missed mark.   The place just seems to have no pride taken in it. It looks dirty inside and out even though there doesn’t appear to be grime accumulating on the surfaces, which suggests it just isn’t thoroughly cleaned enough. The rooms suggest they have been were remodeled recently but the contractors did horrible work. Even an apprentice should be able to run a smooth bead of calking along the tub and install a faucet straight and not crooked, but not here. The manufacturers label for installation was faded but still on the toilet for goodness sake.   The AC units were loud and likely on their last leg, but on the flip side did provide enough white noise to drown out the sounds

Summary Heading: STAY AWAY! RUNDOWN ROOMS & HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT- UNSAFE AREA
Summary: The first room given to me had a chunk of marijuana under the bed. The phone was not working. Curtains were broken. Bathtub constantly running water. Hair all over the bathtub. Furniture broken. AC had mold on it. I was then moved to another room. In the second room, phone was also not working. Food bits on the floor near the beds. Food and dead insects under neath desk and refrigerator area. Bathroom has a hole in the wall for some unfinished plumbing. Ironing boards had weird unknown stains on it. I asked for a new phone, did not get it for 2 days. The MANAGEMENT WAS HORRIBLE. When told about all these problems an employee said the manager would give a discount for the inconvenience. Manager did not live up to his word. Instead pointed fingers at me as if I set up the mess in

We stayed here at the beginning of October for 3 nights. When we checked in the staff were polite and helpful. The hotel has plenty of free parking.  Our room was old and dingy, in desperate need of a refurb. There was mold on the curtains and a stale smell in the room. The iron nearly electrocuted us and was very unsafe.  The only positive thing was the bed was extremely comfortable. The rooms are not particularly sound proof and you can hear people leaving and coming back to their rooms. There is a free breakfast in the mornings, which consists of fruit, toast, waffles, pancakes, sausages etc. This was pretty handy.  Location wise, the hotel was well located. It was close to knotts Berry Farm, medieval knights, restaurants and shops.

This family suite has a king & and fold out queen (couch) in the main room with a TV and full bathroom. The adjoining room also has a full bath along with a queen bed and TV. The complimentary breakfast food goes quickly, but is replenished too. Egg pancakes and sausages along with the standard cereals/waffles, and danishes. I have Celiac Disease, so I simply bring my own muffins as most places do not carry GF cold cereal. There are NO elevators for the 2nd floor rooms. You need to use aggragate on concrete stairs. One of the marble counters in our room was separating at a corner. I noticed that Quality Inn was updating in the lobby. Hopefully, they will get to the rooms soon. If you have children, keep them close to you! While eating breakfast I noticed the pool gate propped

I was actually pretty impressed with this budget hotel.  Staff were friendly, pool area looked clean and it was relatively quiet apart from guests leaving in the morning.  The motel was located so close to Knotts Berry Farm!   I would stay here again for a short stay.  Free breakfast in the morning.  Mainly bread and waffles etc.

Do not go here they are crooks charge a holing deposit for you room. I stayed here payed the holding deposit and was told I would get that when I checked out which I am still waiting for and also have been charged many times The people on reseption do not know what they are doing

This is an older property but you get more than what you pay for here.  The suites hold up to 6 adults with two separate vanities and baths.  It can be quite a walk from the back of the hotel to breakfast, but the food was more than adequate (pancakes, waffles, fruit, pastries, cereal, eggs and sausage).  I read some earlier negative reviews and did not find any areas that were applicable to my stay. Attention management:  Someone propped open the pool gate in the morning with a traffic cone.  That is a MAJOR safety issue.

Stayed there for 2 nights a week ago.  Booked a 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms for 2 adult couples.  Not what we got.  Went to desk to get the right type of room.  We were told there were none available. Asked to speak with the manager and was told he wouldn't be back until the next day.   Left my number and ask him to call me with 3 different front desk staff on 3 different occasions and even left a note.  NOTHING!!!  Had the booking company call and finally he responded to them.  He is a piece of work, gave us $15 refund on a $250 stay.  Made it seem like it was our problem.  The hotel is a hot mess.  Run down, something you would expect to find on an old abandoned road in the middle of nowhere.  Shower randomly sends out HOT, HOT water, Lights burned out, fan and light in

I rarely take the time to review, but some of what we encountered needs to be addressed. The hotel was in poorly maintained condition. Although it looks like the lobby may have been reno’ed recently, the front desk had a plywood facing. The trash cans were overflowing the whole time we were there, there were no pool towels except in the overflowing dirty bin, the furniture was worn down and torn, the in room phone was “vintage,” the overall feel was low quality and dated. On the positive side, it was conveniently located and the waffles were decent. We will not be staying at a Quality Inn again.

Stayed for 3 nights at the start of our road trip and wasn't disappointed. Yes, the rooms need updating but they were clean. Stayed in Room 216 which faces the pool. Beds were extremely comfortable and the shower was very powerful. Fridge, microwave, ironing board etc. in the room. Breakfast was good but there was always a queue for the waffle maker - need another of these in the breakfast area. Toaster wasn't very good - only 1 side worked (2 slices) and this only toasted 1 side of the bread. Other than that this was a good hotel to stay at. Check in/out was straightforward and easy.

I took three of my kids to California for Labor Day weekend. I always stay at Choice hotels when I travel and this hotel was a good price. When I checked in the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I reserved a 3 queen bed suite when I got to my room I was first surprised at how big the rooms were and second how clean it was. The sheets and towels were clean, the carpet was clean and my suite had two bathrooms which were both clean. The hotel was packed with people over the weekend so the only downside was the internet could not work properly because it was on overload and it didn't matter what time you went for breakfast, it was crowded and people did not want to move for other people so on Sunday and Monday I did not go to the breakfast area, which consisted of sausage,

A good hotel, employee attitude and customer management is good. We arrived at a pre-booked room and because of a problem, upgraded us to a better room. The main difficulty is in the morning, we were there in August and the hotel was full - the queue at breakfast was long and unbearable, the worker there could not control everything and was lacking cutlery and food details Besides that - a nice, clean pool, good service and a hotel for my satisfaction

Summary Heading: Business Stay, Long walk to the back of the property
Summary: Looks to be doing some remodeling. Desk people were somewhat friendly but not overly.  My room was newly remodeled in the very back of the property but I didn't have a car so I had an almost 1/4 mile hike to and from the lobby/pickup area.  Also the wifi didn't work in that back area. I mentioned it to the front desk but I never noticed they fixed anything. (I was there 3 nights).  Also when I called an Uber, the address it picked up was a back street by my room instead of the front lobby address of the hotel.  Not the hotel's fault but be aware to order the Uber from where you want picked up.  Might stay here again as it was cheaper so you get what you pay for.

We stayed here for the first 3 nights of our road trip. Really enjoyed our stay. The place was clean and the staff were friendly. Good location near to a nice bar and restaurant and Knott’s Berry Farm. The pool area was good which my kids enjoyed. Can’t think of anything I didn’t like.

Fire Alarm hanging from wall was secured with electrical tape, unsafe! Furnishings are in very poor condition including, desk, chair, TV and Night Stand. Complained to front desk their reply was hotel is still in renovation process, they offered to move me following day, but saw that the other rooms were in this same condition. Recently this hotel was taken over by Quality Inn, I would say nothing had Quality but pool, even the hot tub was poor, colder than the pool. Have stayed here in the past, would have to say it is going downhill fast, next time will find something else! Very Disappointing!!

This is an older property, not well cared for. Room smelled really dirty. The fold out couch had a questionable bottom sheet, no top sheet, blanket or pillow. The mattress was THIN and very musty. I did the best I could to clean it up with wipettes,. Had to go to office for bedding.The blanket was really wrinkled like it was pulled out of a basket. The pool area was okay. I would not stay here again

Summary Heading: Hoping hot tub and breakfast are saving graces...
Summary: Pretty loud here and just like I mentioned to Expedia... Our room is quite weak... Fridge not cold at all, microwave not working at all and was asked to go down and retrieve another myself weirdly. Internet quite slow and very few outlets to plug in cell phones and a laptop. Tv small too and room outdated big time, needing a big upgrade when they book so much and turn over is HUGE here as a great location! COME ON! GEESH! Lets hope breakfast is ok and hot tub too!  Fingers crossed!

If i could give 0 stars i would. The customer service is horrible. They told me it would be $25 to check in early. When i ask why, they said it was to rush house keeping to get over there and clean the room. When i said ok. They told me they had a room ready immediately but that they were still going to charge me $25 to go in the room at 1pm because check in was not until 4pm. I said that did not make since. I understand if you didn't have a room ready but since you do why are you still going to charge me. They said just because its policy. We ask to speak to a manager and Richard Guarmon came out and he was rude and the only words that would come out of his mouth was, if we wanted to check in now we have to pay $25. We asked for their corporate office number and he gave us

Loved my stay at This quality inn location. My family and I were in town for vacation at Knotts Berry Farm and we were fortunate enough to find a great price at quality inn! Plus, the hotel itself has very diligent and kind staff that made sure our stay was perfect. The rooms were very clean and the daily breakfast was always superb. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Anaheim/Buena Park.

Looked at some of the older reviews and was a little worried. I was pleasantly surprised with the brand new lobby and breakfast area. Front desk staff was helpful when I needed a recommendation on where to eat. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Suites Are Excellent, Lobby is a Mess
Summary: I was very apprehensive about staying here after reading other reviews, but went with it as I was traveling with 6 people and needed a room that was big enough for all of us, and it was located close to a freeway so I could travel to Disneyland easily.  Maybe I was lucky and got one of the good rooms, but I thought this place was excellent.  I got a two bed, one couch/pull out with two bathrooms (it was the "Shakespeare Suite"...I found the naming of the suites to be a very fun and charming touch). It had plenty of towels, the beds were reasonably comfortable and it had all of the amenities I would expect and then some (fridge, microwave, blow dryer, iron). I found the bathrooms to be pretty on par with what you expect with a hotel in this price range. I found no weird stains or

We stayed here for 3 nights over New Years 2019.  Arrived at about 12/12:30 AM after a long drive.  Were told by the woman at the desk that they didn't have a reservation for us despite having booked 2 weeks prior.  We even showed her our confirmation # but still no room.  Wouldn't even let us in to use restroom.  Eventually drove down the street to the IHOP to use the bathroom.  Had to stay outside and contact our booking agency (that was another time consuming lesson in frustration) who called the hotel but she still said she had no reservation for us.  She offered us a different room than we booked for about twice as much.  Tried another hotel down the road but they were booked up.  Went back to the hotel and somehow she discovered our reservation on the desk which had been

Read the reviews. Don't come.. We are actually staying in this nightmare now.. No room cleaning , rude very rude employees, rain falling inside the main building in the breakfast area... Reviews are short... Terrible

My family, along with many other families recently took a Disneyland bus tour and the Tour company booked us to stay here. We had a Family suite in the back of the property that is not convienient to any of the amenities. The pool heater is broken and has been for the last number of years and the hotel keeps telling the tour company that brings no less than 90 people to them every few months, that they have made improvements, later to find out that they haven’t. The hot tub was out of order for a portion of our stay, and when it was working the chlorine was so strong it burnt the eyes, nostrils and skin. 2 minutes was too long to be in it. My son picked 3 large chlorine pucks out of it in the minute he was in it one of the times. No towels by the pool. Not all of the outlets

we.stayed for a week last month and not a pleasant experience first off no jot water the entire week secondly the free breakfast was a joke there is a pump coffee mate dispenser that dispensed rotten cream room had a mouldy smell dirty carpet maid came to clean room at 5pm every day of our stay spend a little more to get a lot more there were tweakers staying monthly as well trying to sell cigarettes etc for their next fix didnt have a safe feel to the place

If you are looking for a bed and a simple breakfast why not! The place is on a main road so it can be loud. But I didn't expect much considering the rate I paid. The bed was comfortable, breakfast was decent, and the showers worked. One thing is when cut off time for breakfast happens it happens at that exact minute they don't care if you are trying to grab something. But waffles were good there were two cereals to choose from yogurts and the cute little mini muffins. The beds are comfortable for a one night stay after a long day at Knotts. Only downfall of the room which I've seen it on the reviews and I totally agree the towels were literally like sandpaper. For the most part I would say here again because it was so close to the park and it was easy to sleep on the bed. If

Everyone says it you get what you paid for and it's true. However that being said you know what to expect for the cost so you shouldn't be complaining. The bed was comfortable, the shower worked well and breakfast was waffles, cereal, bagels and muffins. The downside was the sandpaper towels and the AC didn't really work that well and it was also loud for the unit. However as it was only to sleep after a long day at Knotts, I would stay there again but bring my own towels for the cost! Side not there is NOT ENOUGH outlets!

We were here for two nights in which we were not able to sleep. The first night there were more families together having fun all night long. The second night (it’s now 1.58 hours), a lot of new guests are coming in with a lot of noise. This is already going on for one hour right now.   Old noisy rooms with a good bed. Too bad that it’s impossible to have any sleep here. For business people it’s absolutely a no go I would say.  Gr. Rudmer

You get what you pay for. We had a last-minute idea to get out of town for the weekend, so I booked the room the day we left town. The room was a bargain, and it was in a good location, so that was nice.  The guy at check-in was nice and helpful. The parking was free, and they had free WiFi. The room itself was bigger than I expected, though it was very dated. My husband remarked that the hotel was more "motel" than "hotel", and he was right.  Still, it was clean-ish. The bed wasn't great, but it did the job for the night. The walls were super thin, and there were only two outlets available in the entire room - one in the bathroom area and one in the closet area. It's an older room, so I shouldn't have expected a lot of connectivity options, but having at least one outlet by the

Summary Heading: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. SOMETIMES LESS.
Summary: I PRIDE MYSELF ON GIVING FAIR REVIEWS AND THIS IS AN IDEA OF WHAT MY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE WAS. When we checked into the Hotel around 9pm on Thursday night, I noticed that the Lobby was clean and nicely decorated for Halloween. Upon check in I was greeted very nicely by their front desk employee.  Check in was pleasant and simple and I was charged a 50.00 deposit for 2 nights. I was hoping to get one of the rooms with a refrigerator, but as usual, when they saw that I booked my room with a 3rd party, I was not given a choice and I was going to have to get one of their less expensive rooms with no flexibility. There was ample parking and we were able to park right in front of our room which is always nice. (Free parking). Our room was small but appeared to be clean with 2 queen

This has to be one of the best hotels I’ve ever been to. The location is great, as well as the staff and the rooms. Another bonus is the short distance away from Knots, and Disney Land! I will definitely be staying here again next break!

This is a great place to stay for the price!! Staff is really nice and are very helpful when called upon. We have stayed here a dozen times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are always very clean and organized with pretty paint and furniture. Just make sure you get there before the morning rush for the free breakfast. They have waffles, bagels, donuts, oatmeal and things of the sort. Great value for the whole package, especially since it's located across the street from Medieval Times and down the street from Knott's Berry Farm

We checked in at 2AM and they put us in the back area where it looks like a different hotel.  We we're in the Natalie Wood suite however it wasnt that great looking. Furniture looked like it gart bulk pick up. The desk was broken. One of the lamps didn't work. The carpet was dirty. My son's feet were black so I made sure my family wore flip flops in the room. Here's the kicker..we had a police officer wake us up to see if we heard any commotion going on outside because some was stabbed in the room diagonally above us. When checking out I spoke with Annabelle at the front desk to let her know how unsatisfied I was a out the whole situation and she cut me off and said she'll speak to the manager about compensation. My wife and I have stayed here before and had no issues, however

Summary Heading: Last minute booking, and it was ok
Summary: We booked here last minute, and it is ok, room was a little noisy as next to the freeway, but not too bad, the room was clean, and the staff friendly. The pool area was great, and we enjoyed a swim. Breakfast was disappointing as they kept running out, and it was a bit of a bun fight to get anything and somewhere to sit and eat it.

The hotel has a good location and friendly check-in folks.  The rooms are pretty clean, but worn out.  The towels are like brillo pads and the bedding is pretty gross.  The breakfast is very simple, with the usual waffle, toast and bagel assortment.  I don't think I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Filthy gross and staff dosen't care
Summary: Pictures speak for themselves  These pictures were taken upon arrival on Friday 8/3/18 at approximately 9:30 pm.  There were stains on both bed sheets, appeared to be possible blood stains and other soiled with a yellowish substance. Couch had a few big stains, coffee pot was never washed from previous occupants and there was a broken drawer.  We reported everything and asked for clean sheets that night. However, front desk said they were fully booked and couldn't do anything due to no one from maintenance was available. We went to front desk to see if we can get replacement bedding and all they had was one blanket for our family of four.  The following day we called again and and asked for a manager to call us back and never got a call back. So again, we walked to front desk to

We are here for 17 nights coming from Iceland. The hotel reception could do with a makeover. Our room's are satisfactory, the beads are good serviced every other day, the linen is clean. The carpets could do with a cleaning. The staff is friendly and courteous. Over all the stay so far is Good. We are geting what we paid in my opinion.

Pool was dirty. Told they have on site security but apparently not, since my new car was keyed within view of a security camera. Manager refused to do more than take a report and is refusing to return any calls related to the damage. I would give a zero if I could

Summary Heading: Great price and location, needs some love and new AC system
Summary: This worked out ok for what my boys and I needed, which was basically a place to sleep at end of Disney days with close proximity to restaurants for dinner. Just a couple blocks from freeway to Disney and about 10 min trip to park. Bed was ok. Had a mini fridge and microwave, toiletries. Shower/bath slow to drain and could use updating. AC is horrible, leaks inside room onto carpet and outside room has a draining bucket under it and still does not cool to desired temp which was a bummer. Facility includes breakfast, which we dis not partake as we hit Disney at opening which worked out great! Also has ping pong table and pool, my boys liked the ping pong, we did not use the pool. Across the street there is a pirate themed dinner facility and next door is an Outback and fast food

This reasonably priced hotel had everything we needed. Close enough to Disneyland (Uber was perfect for coming and going to the park), convenient highway access, fairly direct route to John Wayne Airport, free breakfast was satisfying, rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff were polite and helpful, and the pool was great for a no sand alternative to the beach. The Pirate Dinner Adventure is across the street, highly recommended!

I had reservations for 5 adults in a suite. Upon arrival,  the room had 2 queen beds. I'm not sure where they thought we would put a 5th adult. We had to leave to find another room at a different hotel. While I was in the room, I noticed it was fairly clean. I ended up at Howard Johnson's, which was much cleaner and it cost about $60.00 less. Next time I'm in the area I will pass on Buena Parks Hotel and Suites and head over to Howard Johnson's.

Summary Heading: Sofa Bed Is Not for Grandma
Summary: We spent a couple extra days then Buena Park after a cruise. Comparing this motel to the VIP service we got on the cruise and there is no comparison.  I rented this room because it provided two queen-size beds and a sofa sleeper. There were five of us we needed the room. Unfortunately, I let the adult children and two grandchildren have the queen beds and I took the sofa bed. What a mistake! The mattress on this bed was probably not much thicker than 2 inches.  But let me start at the beginning. This room has 2 bathrooms a definite plus when you have 5 people in a room.  I went in to take a shower and saw black debris on the floor.  Who cleaned this room didn't do a very good job.  When I started water it appeared there were a couple bugs in the tub.  Fortunately, when I tried

I travel with a family of 6 and we are always looking for 2 bedroom suites at a decent price. This is a basic, no frills motel. Here's the pros and cons: Pros-great price, large rooms, some suites have 2 bathrooms, free parking, free breakfast (breakfast is minimal) and free WiFi, good selection of cable channels. Cons: It's an older motel, rooms show wear and tear, sofa bed was broken in our room and there was no hot water...we had to switch rooms and manager gave us a small credit to our bill. Overall I recommend it, but seriously advise you to check out your room, making sure all components are working before you unpack.

At Buena Park Hotel & Suites we had a very good apartment - the Hoover suite. Here it's available two rooms, one very large, with very comfortable beds, and other - smaller with a sofa and TV set. The bathroom is o.k. The breakfast was average. But there you can admire some bushes well maintained, with wonderful flowers.

My sister(who is also my manager) and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights recently while attending an awards ceremony in Pasadena and shooting some music video in Malibu. The location was perfect for our purpose. If you are looking for a place near Knott's Berry Farm, it is within walking distance and close to everything. We were very impressed with Kurt, Antoine, Michael, Carol, Dulce, and the whole staff during our stay. They made us feel very welcome and were always there to take care of our needs. The beds were very comfortable and the staff kept our room clean. The room had a refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, and everything we needed including a complementary breakfast every morning. There is also a very nice swimming pool in the center of the complex. I stayed there 5

Summary Heading: Not as good as the first time
Summary: We initially stayed at this hotel two years ago and we were so happy with the place that we decided to stay at it again during our visit to Anaheim, California March/April 2018 for spring break.  We arrived at the hotel very late at 2am and after travelling with two tired kids over 12 hours we were very tired and hungry. The hotel doors are closed and so you have to go to the side and check in through the glass window. We were not greeted or welcomed or anything by the graveyard shift attendant. No smile on her face nothing at all. I was not impressed with her lack of customer service at all. I work in customer service and a small smile after a long journey would have made a huge difference. No, instead she blankly gave us our keys and we were on our way.  Went to our room only

Very disappointed in all aspects of our stay at the Buena Park Hotel. Check in was very slow (we were the only ones in the lobby), the 2 rooms we had were equally dirty (carpet, curtains, chair), one of our towels had make up on them (gross), the breakfast was marginal. The donuts that were out were frozen, bagels had no taste. I disagree with another reviewer that it was worth the money spent. Don’t bother.

Not bad for the price you pay... good location, easy to find, pool is clean, beds are comfortable, staff is nice, pool is clean, and we made great family moments. The only bed this is that a few things in our room were broken but its not bad...

Thank you Hotels Helping Heroes for assisting me in my trip to L.A. The Buena Park Hotel and Suites was not what I was expecting; I was disappointed. I ended up paying out of pocket to stay elsewhere because I felt this location was outdated and dirty. This is a renovated motel that shows upgrades. Carpet needs replacement and bathroom was outdated. I check for bedbugs at all my hotels, under the mattress, behind headboards and all over. I am not certain I found bed bug egg shells, but my photos explain why I stayed elsewhere. Hotels helping heroes is a great organization that hooked me up in the past when I stayed in Scottsdale, AZ. I think Los Angeles is a tough spot to get a clean, reasonably priced hotel. L.A. is very expensive for hotels and Buena Park is a major tourist

Large room, comfortable king size bed. Clean and well maintained. Effective aircon. Close to convention centre and Disneyland. Ideal for a family. Within walking distance from good restaurants. Friendly staff.

I was concerned that this hotel might be noisy due to its proximity to the freeway but I didn't notice freeway noise, however the walls are so thin you can hear noise from surrounding rooms. All night long we could hear televisions and talking from the neighbors. The bathroom could definitely use some updating as well. However the front desk staff was excellent and the price was very reasonable especially since we stayed here during the NAMM show and prices were sky high in Anaheim.

We got to the hotel after dark and left in the morning.  We wanted a medium price room due to the short time being there.  Room was clean.  Continental breakfast was served.  Donuts were boxed from a grocery store but fresh.

very nice and comfortable ...bed are soooo comfortable.great water pressure for shower washer and dryer available. breakfast was good . hot tub and pool were a very nice addition. close to may great eating spots

Clean, friendly staff, and convenient location within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants and bakery/cafes.  Quiet courtyard, nice pool area, ping pong room and free breakfast with coffee/tea available 24 hrs.  The manager went out of his way to ensure our group had a great stay.  Will be returning next year

I was recently in Buena Park while touring with a musical artist. We had been in this area many times but this was the first time in this particular hotel.   The rooms were perfectly sized, clean, fully stocked with whatever we needed and the beds extremely comfortable.  The hotel itself has a great "vibe" to it. The staff and manager Kurt were wonderful and very attentive to not only our party but all the guests.  Free continental breakfast was fine and it was nice to see so many families in the hotel.  We travel most of the year and stay in quite a few hotels. The Buena Park Hotel and Suites will surely be my go to when in the area. You can't go wrong for the price!

Summary Heading: Nice, Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location
Summary: I recently had to spend some time traveling around Southern California, and my itinerary had me traveling through the Buena Park area a few times.  Each time I have stayed at this hotel, and am very happy with everything here.   To begin, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the beds are very comfortable.  I found a new Samsung flat screen in my room, with a great variety of channels (including numerous premium cable stations...something you don't see in every hotel).  There's a nice pool area (with a hot tub too), on-site laundry, free breakfast every day, and even a ping pong table.  And, the staff here is terrific...friendly and very accommodating.  Any question or request I've had has been take care of without any problem at all.  If you're looking for a great hotel value

I just spent a few at this hotel and it was great! My room was right outside the pool and I got located to everything I needed, including Dollar Tree and Target. The checking and out was quick and painless. Any hotel with a free continental breakfast is okay in my book so I really enjoyed that. The parking lot and grounds was well kept and the cleaning staff was nice and all spoke when I walked in passing. I’d definitely stay here again when I’m in California!

We really enjoyed our stay here and in fact are coming back for a later part of our trip. It was very quiet, the beds were comfortable, it was clean, and included breakfast. The pool and hot tub were well-maintained and the staff was extremely friendly .   It also was in a great location right within walking distance to some great restaurants and attractions. I recommend!

Summary Heading: Some pros & cons to staying there
Summary: I saw both positive and negative things about this hotel/motel after our two days stay.  First the pros:  It is very inexpensive, and has two bedroom suites and other room options that can help a family on a budget.  It also has a decent breakfast that can also help with a family on a budget.  They do have a pool that is great during the summer, but is very cold during the winter months.  Another plus is that it is only 4 minutes walk from Knott's Berry Farm and a 10-minute drive from Disneyland, which makes it very convenient.   Now for the negatives:  We booked a two bedroom suite.  We found that the heater/AC is in the front room of the suite so when the door is closed between the two rooms, the second room gets very little benefit from the unit.  The front room is

I had nothing to complain about this hotel except that this feels a lot more like motel than hotel. It was from 7 minutes drive from Disneyland which we stayed for that purpose. It was close from many restaurants and fast food. The water was strong, the wifi was nice, the toilet clean. The price was fine.  The only problem was the chair. No chair in the room. I guess people do not sit in this hotel, just lie down the bed  The breakfast was better than other motels but nothing hot. They only juice they have is orange juice. The only fruit is apple but quite various types of bread.  All in all, okay place

They charged $5 per piece of bag left at front desk prior to check if room wasn't ready. No fridge in room. Room was dim. 15 minutes walk to Knotts Berry Farm. Had requested for ground level room as we had many luggages and we were given room close to lobby which we are happy about. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast had waffle maker, doughnuts, muffins, bananas, apples, cereals, which was good enough.

At first I was hesitant to reserve a room after some of the bad reviews, but I did because the price was so good. I was totally satisfied. It’s a block from Knotts, walking distance to all kinds of restaurants and entertainment and all around convenient. Room was clean, air worked great, nice pool area. Hotel staff attentive. If you are looking for economical bcuz you’d rather spend your money on entertainment, this is a great place.

Summary Heading: Good Amenities at a Great Price
Summary: Are you an ready for that super Southern Cal working experience?  If so, check into the Buena Park Hotel & Suites, Buena Park, CA.  I did. It is 1 block from the Artesia freeway.  With 157 suites to choose from including large family suites, the earnest traveler can’t go wrong.  The Buena Park Hotel & Suites deserves an A for location.  It is positioned 2 blocks from Knotts Berry Farm, 2 miles from Disneyland, directly across the street from the Pirates of the Cove Dinner Theatre, and right next to an Outback Steakhouse.  I was given room 117.  The Hotel provides a pool, table tennis, advice, and most gratifying to me:  Complimentary breakfast every AM from 7:30 to 9;30.  A family of 2 or more saves a bundle on the coffee, juice, milk, cereal, bagel, and waffle breakfast.  The

Recently stayed at Buena Park Hotel & Suites in LA. The location was awesome - close to everything a traveling comedian would need. The rooms were clean and staff friendly. Ample parking, nice pool area, quiet even though close to a busy street.

The rooms could use some updating for the price, but overall it was a good choice for our one night stay.  It seemed a little on the expensive side, but it is in a prime location for Knott's Berry Farm.  No mini fridge in the room, comfortable beds, decent shower.  We didn't make it for breakfast, but it smelled great and the lobby was nice.  I would stay here again.

The front desk people were really nice. The room was definitely average. Nothing too crazy but not as much as a suite as a slightly upgraded room. We were looking for a room that was close to Knotts Berry Farm and this was easy walking distance to the park. They did have a pool and cement picnic areas that was nice outside the rooms. Its good and bad only cause there were lots of kids running around outside. For the most part we were not there to hang out at the hotel so it served its purpose.

From check in, front desk staff were awesome. Polite, profession and smiled & really seemed to care. Room was clean, couldn't find a issue. Breakfast was mostly carbs and bananas. .despite this being a family hotel...it was very quiet. Will be back !!!!

This hotel is in need of some serious work... it is a bit older and although it served its purpose the price does not fit the accommodations..staff was mediocre breakfast was free which was the only thing good about it...! Just expected more for the price... there are tons of hotels within walking distance of this one that offer a way better price point for the amenities afforded by this property!

I had a relaxing couple days at the Buena Park Hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful even though I got in late. The room was very clean and the building was old but nice. For the amount of people staying it was pretty quiet. They had a bagel conveyor belt in the breakfast area and that's great as was the rest of breakfast. Located across from Pirate Adventure Dinner if that's your thing.

Stayed the night to go to The Pirate Adventure across the street. Very clean, the office staff were very helpful and did a great job, the breakfast was good, coffee, bagels, waffles juice milk. we will come and stay again if we go to knotts

This hotel is very clean and comfy. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the courtyard, where they have a very nice large swimming pool and jacuzzi. The hotel USB conviently located just off the highway andr within walking distance of several bars Andy restaurants.

I chose this property for its location and I was not disappointed. We were able to walk to medieval times. Outback Steakhouse is right next door.  Those are my only positives.  Employee that checked me in was rude,  my room didn't look clean, the noise from the plumbing was so loud, you couldn't hear the tv. When checking out I asked for a printout of my bill, told I would receive in my email, never did.

Very comfy space. Very clean and well kept for the age of the hotel. Very comfortable bed and excellent climate control. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in buena park, California whether it was long term or short term.

I recently stayed at the Buena Park Hotel and Suites for 3 days and my experience was excellent.  Great hotel, excellent staff, and awesome location. Everyone was very welcoming and my room was very clean. Everything you could possibly need was within a 10 min drive. They even had an amusement park a few blocks away lol. I will definitely be staying there again whenever I'm back in the area.

At check in the man at the front desk wasn't terribly friendly. After check in when I came back into the alley with a heavy suitcase in tow he just watched me walk it up the stairs. The linens on the bed were clean. The towels super cheap, but clean too. The bathroom though was gross. I couldn't bathe my daughter in the tub because it was filthy and stained. There was mold, too. There were also stains on the carpet.  When we got into our room it took hours before the air conditioner could cool it down- when we walked in the air was hot and thick.  The breakfast was a diabetics nightmare! Everything was packed with sugar and carbs. Even the oatmeal options had sugar added. It really would've been nice if they had some eggs or such.  The one plus was the location. It was what

Great location with easy access to so many attractions. Pirate's Dinner Adventure and Medieval Times basically across the street, close to Knott's Berry Farm and only about a ten minute drive to Disneyland.  Marco at the front desk was friendly and helpful (also offered excellent restaurant advice). Lots of parking, room was clean and beds are very comfortable. Good selection for breakfast: fruit, juice, waffles ... all fresh and tasty. Would definitely stay here again

I stayed here during a youth baseball tournament nearby in Whittier.   Not great.  Ice machines didn't work.  Pool was shut down.  Room wasn't ready at 3pm.  Bathrooms were very small and shower runs a little hot/cold.  I also had an encounter with the hotel manager that was less than satisfying -- pretty low class establishment in my view considering I paid $130 for a standard room.  They were very busy with all of the teams from local baseball tournament and they seemed totally overwhelmed & not in control of the situation.  There was a baseball team tailgating right outside my door late into the night in the parking lot?  Giant tour buses starting there engines in the parking lot at 5 AM and idling for half an hour!?  It was mayhem.  Perhaps when they are not so Busy the

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay In Buena Park!
Summary: The Buena Park Hotel & Suites was one of the most conveniently located hotels we've stayed in, being right off the freeway 91. We were within walking distance from Buena Parks best attractions. Huge non-smoking rooms with an insanely soft king bed, fridge, microwave, and a giant pull out couch. In the morning, after hitting the gym provided by the hotel, we indulged in an all inclusive breakfast buffet. I can tell you we'll definitely be back next time we are in the area. Thanks for a great stay, Buena Park!

When we first arrived our room was not what we were told.  We book the family suite and was suppose to be on the bottom floor because I can not do stairs right now.  We were told the room was defiantly on the bottom floor.  It was not.  So we had to get two rooms.  Then on the morning of check out the maid came by and  proceeded to come into the room and clean while we were still trying to pack. We repeatedly told her we were not ready to leave.  Check out was at noon and it was on 10.  She could not speak English.  We felt like we were being pushed out.  It was very uncomfortable.

We are traveling entertainers so we stay in a lot of hotels and I have to say the Buena Park Hotel and Suites are a lovely property.  The staff are extremely helpful and  there is plenty of parking.  The hotel is in a safe area of town with a lot of entertainment options like Knots Berry Farm, Medeval Times etc.  There is a pool and hot tub and the rooms are very clean with comfortable beds.  Highly recommend!!!

I’m so glad we stayed at this hotel. Not only was it really close to Disneyland, but it’s also within walking distance to several other tourist attractions. Plus, its close proximity to the freeway (literally right next to the exit ramp) was really convenient. The staff was very nice, and the continental breakfast was more than adequate. The rooms were spacious and clean. Our room was right by the pool, but still quiet enough that we didn’t hear people when they were swimming. The jacuzzi was really nice as well and certainly hit the spot after a long day of walking at Disney. This property also has ample parking, and we were able to park really close to our room.

Summary Heading: Hotel stay was great, Management was Horrible
Summary: My stay in the hotel was a pleasant stay, pool access, short drive to Knott's and breakfast was easy and fast. I did have a little trouble checking inn but was able to enjoy our stay. Before leaving I wanted to make sure there were no issues with my credit card, there was so I gave them another card and was told all matters were taken care of and I would be sent a confirmation email with the charges.Half way home I get a call from the hotel manager who by the way was so rude and accused me of running off without paying my bill (Mr. Clark) he kept on and on about how I was rude and would not wait for by closing bill. During this time he would not let me get in a word edge wise. Note to future guest to this hotel, if you are approached by management run, no one needs to be treated

Summary Heading: Good location...on the freeway off ramp
Summary: Our room was literally 20 ft from the Beach Bl. off ramp of the 91 freeway AND there was a hole in the fence with caution tape around it. The car that went through it must have nearly come into our room. The walls were paper thin so we could hear everything in the rooms around us. The hotel offers free breakfast and although we had not planned on eating there we did want coffee. We were not surprised to find the breakfast room overrun with unsupervised children. On the plus side, the hotel is right across the street from Medieval Times and we were able to walk there and back.

This is a no frills and comfortable hotel for its price.  Just under $100  The decor is the lobby is tired. The breakfast is continental plus a waffle maker.  The staff were pleasant   The rooms weren't entirely outdated   The pool and spa are old  Worthy trip on a budget for business or families

Summary Heading: Convenient location, courteous and helpful staff, nice rooms and amenities.
Summary: First off, very convenient location...right off freeway 91. So driving to the hotel and going back to the freeway was a breeze.  Ample parking. Nice lobby. Friendly staff. I checked in pretty late at night but they had two very nice staff members at the counter. I had called in before I arrived so they were expecting me. Annabelle (I hope I am spelling it correctly) checked me in.  The room was clean and both queen-sized beds were well made. I got a large room with a desk, fridge, microwave, and a coffeemaker. What else a man can ask for?  The carpet was clean, the AC was cool, soaps and lotions were of nice quality...and most importantly the towels were soft.  I stayed for two nights. I had to call maintenance because I could not figure out how to raise the revolving chair. A

My first impression of the hotel staff was impressive. I thought they were genuinely kind and pleasant. I was given specific directions to my room with a map included. I also was provided with local businesses that delivered to my room if wanting room service.  The room was clean and tidy. I was able to spruce it up a little with a little touch of air freshner and some TLC to make it feel a bit more comfortable for me. I loved the pillows and the bed slept well.  My overall stay was pleasant and satisfactory. I was able to sleep peacefully without a lot of outside distractions.

The Buena Park Hotel & Suites has an amazing staff and great location. Everything from the parking, to check-in, rooms, breakfast, and check-out were very on point and positive. This Hotel is a great spot for any traveler for any purpose. Weather it's for business in LA or entertainment and vacation to any of the nearby amusement and theme parks. I highly recommend this Hotel!

Summary Heading: Family suites are good, basic rooms are not
Summary: Stayed as part of a group.  Family suites were much larger than typical hotel rooms, with 2 bathrooms.  Would recommend for families.  Basic 2 queen rooms feel very small and outdated.  Some room locations were very loud.  The breakfast is NOT good.  Cheerios and stale donuts.  The hotel needs to improve this.  Everyone in our group said they had to go elsewhere to eat.

My son and I were on spring break and wanted a hotel close to Knotts Berry Farm.  We got it, but the room was not what the pictures showed.  The smell when you enter was pretty bad... carpet definitely needs an upgrade.  TV channels only worked half the time and the ones we were able to see had nothing for my 10 year old.  The pool was uninviting and had so many kids running around the pool and throughout the hotel corridor.  I understand the hotel doesn't babysit, but any place I've stayed has made sure the parents are aware and kids are dealt with. At night, I had some weird woman prank calling, or perhaps trying to solicit,  so I disconnected the phone.  Personal said it was probably someone just doing a prank, AS IF THAT MADE ME FEEL SAFE.   The breakfast area was too small,

We had a family suite at the back of the hotel. It was very quiet. Rooms were spacious and clean.  Two bathrooms in the suite and a ground floor room were really great with a toddler. Close to shops and restraunts and knotts berry farms.

Summary Heading: Noise Issues And No Hot Water
Summary: During our recent trip to Anaheim we stayed at the Buena Park Hotel and Suites in Beautiful Buena Park California. The hotel is located near Medieval Times and the Pirate Dinner Theater as well as numerous other tourist and dining options.  Knott’s Berry Farm is a pleasant fifteen-twenty minute walk away as well.  Our check in was easy enough and we were directed to our room which was a clean but standard hotel room.  The hotel offered free parking and Wi-Fi but was sparse on television stations as we had only a small handful of stations to watch.  We had several issues with noise as many groups of students were staying at the hotel over Spring Break and we had people in the room next to us on three instances attempt to enter our room via the adjoining door and even pounded on

The carpet was in bad shape and very dirty If you traveling with todlers or babies this is not for you The pool is very small  The setting is very weird and the safety is not that great  I think they should increase security in the parking lot by the cars

I stayed here with my 2 boys for a quick trip to the Pirates Dinner Adventure and Knotts Berry Farm. According to the emergency exit sign in the room, it used to be a Best Western. It could definitely use an update. There was popcorn ceiling still and the bathroom was falling apart. No in-room safe, but there was a mini fridge and microwave. Towels were in bad shape and looked dingy like they were used to wipe floors. There was lots of bugs and things on the walls... booger museum? Lol. On the upside, the front desk was extremely nice. Parking is free and breakfast. There wasn't any protein offered, but lots of breads, muffins and such. There's a Burger King next door and plenty of other places to eat. All walking distance and short walk to Knotts. Pirates dinner adventure and

First of all, the hotel is in a great location. Its a 5 minute walk from Knot's Berry Farm. Medieval Time and Porto just right across the street. From the time my family got there we felt welcome. From the lady at the front desk to the maid service. The rooms were clean, beds are very comfortable, and they even had gift toys for my kids.  Their free breakfast was better than expected. We decided to stay a bit longer and enjoy the pool. Kids had a great time and very relaxing. Great stay when in Buena Park.

I want to give a shout out to Buena Park Hotel and Suites for their amazing service! The complimentary breakfast was very filling and the front desk staff went above and beyond to address my needs. Can't wait to come back!

Very nice accomadation. Trip advisor was excellent regarding discounts for hotel stay and the hotel upgraded our room with an onsuite.  Everything was clean. But be sure that if you want to have their breakfast that it closes down promptly at 9:30. I showed up at 10 am and did not get any breakfast at all.

To begin , I am going to advise you to be upfront with the staff at the desk upon arrival . If you are not vocal in your needs you will get the crap room. Also make sure your room rate is correct . They charge person if you don't put the correct number in at time of reservation . We expected to get a nice room as pictured in the photos but nope it looked like a rundown highway motel as seen in a cheesy 80's movie. The carpets are stained, room had a musty smell, bathroom had weird stains in toilet and tub . The housekeepers also left cleaners in our room. There were also little dust bunnies , cookie crumbs and unknowns on the edges of the room. The tv only had 4 stations . The furniture had weird stickiness to them and were either stained or torn . The noise level from outside

OK, so we booked this motel thinking it was a "family suite" which was actually just two rooms converted into a "suite" two bathrooms and all.  Upon arrival, first use, both toilets stopped up, called for a plunger which came about 30 minutes later.  One shower wouldn't drain without holding the lever on the drain.  Crown moulding was a nice touch, but unfinished with nail holes visible, which looked like the gnats that were swarming the room when we first arrived.  The air conditioner in the "living room" rattled like crazy non-stop, but it was better than the sound of the freeway off ramp which was right outside our room #239.  We stayed two nights and we were gone until about 4pm on the second evening, expecting to come back and take a shower in our clean room.  Nope,

Beds are comfortable, but breakfast sucks. It's waffles and donuts but they don't taste good. I booked the hotel because of the breakfast and was very disappointed. The room was a little dirty when I got in. Behind the couch there was a ball of hair and and when my boyfriend grabbed a towel hair was inside of the towel also towels had makeup stains. Very quiet hotel. When we turned the heater on it started to smell like burn hair. There is no safe in the room which is a major down for us so we didn't have the room cleaned to protect our items. They do offer safes downstairs and will give you a key but people have access to wear the safes are. Really close to Disneyland took about 10 min to get to Disney! Near a lot of food places.

Room : clean family room. We were always missing a towel or two and yet the hotel knew by the booking that we were 5 persons. One night around 9pm I called the reception desk for a towel. The person said of course but you must come and get it here because there is no one available to have it delivered. Breakfast : Free breakfast indeed but get there before 9am or else there's nothing left. The first day, the place was packed. We found two unoccupied filthy tables, I looked around hoping to find an employee. Unfortunately I had to go the reception desk to ask if someone could wipe up the tables. And not a minute later, the restaurant supervisor that I disturbed I guess, came out of nowhere with a very unhappy look on her face, to wipe energetically the tables full of sticky

Summary Heading: Great Room for a great price
Summary: Enjoyed our stay here. Friendly and accommodating staff and clean rooms. Great value for the money. Breakfast is too good and very delicious. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. also free parking and wifi services are considerate.

The staff was excellent!  The rooms are very clean, the beds are comfortable, and on the 2nd floor where we stayed they have "Camp Snoopy" rooms.  The hallways and rooms are decorated with the "Peanuts gang", and Snoopy comes to your room every night around 8:00 in his p.j's.  The hotel is super clean.  The hotel restaurant is AWESOME!!  Their chicken pot pie is to die for!  The only "con" that I have is the gift shop is limited on snacks and doesn't have milk, which is very expensive to buy in the restaurant.  I advise you if you have children to request a refrigerator and buy milk. However, there is a gas station market across the street.The parking is FREE if you're a guest in the hotel, and it's VERY convenient as you don't have a far walk to the entrance.

Back in Cali and back at Buena Park Hotel and Suites. Listen it's affordable clean and quiet. What more could you ask for ? They have HBO and free internet. Free parking. They're surrounded by restaurants and stores. The staff is always helpful and friendly. I just said the staff was friendly. You can't buy that in LA surrounding areas. Great location for Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. This place is a well kept secret because I saw people sitting in the pool and it was pouring rain so they have some magic here. Give it a shot, because I always do. And I'll be back again because once again it's affordable clean and quiet.  less

I recently stayed at the Buena Park Hotel Inn & Suites in Buena Park, CA. The bed was very cozy and the room is big. I couldn't enjoy the pool or whirlpool because of the rain heavy. But it was very relaxing and breakfast was good. The location worked well right off the highway. We found plenty of places to eat and overall a great stay for us.

We stayed at the Buena Park Hotel Inn & Suites in Buena Park, CA from Dec 26-Dec29. A very short trip to Disneyland and its right off of the freeway. The Lobby was full of Christmas Spirit with decorations and a Christmas Tree. The FREE breakfast with Belgium waffles Mmmmmmmm ... The rooms are spacious and Clean , the staff are all very friendly , the beds are comfy, the location is great and you have a lot of restaurants close by. My family looks forward to our visits often as it is our home away from home when we come to Los Angeles.

First of all: If you're to spend time in Disneyland or Knotts this is a good choice but if you want to go to LA be aware that the traffic is far from terrible.  Check in and out process were very quick and smooth.  We had a suite with an annex with a sofa bed.  The main room condition was OK except for the carpets that are screaming for renovation.  The annex had an unpleasant moisture-like smell.  And the sofa-bed didn't look very inviting.  Overall, the annex looked very eerie.  We just closed the door and accommodate in the main area.  The beds were very confortably to sleep but the bathroom was tiny.  There's nearly no room between the WC and the bathtub.  Breakfast is offered with a typical US selection of waffles, toasts and juice.  There is a fruit basket which empties

WORST ROOM EVER - 201 Outside noise constant  No sleep whatsoever  Want my money back  Earplugs don't help Outside street traffic noises never stopped not even for one second  This place sucks  Thought about sleeping in the bathroom just to get a break from the noise

Summary Heading: if you want to good economy motel - it's your choice
Summary: Good room - clean, good bed. Breakfast was good (for traditional motel) - bakery, cereals, toasts, sometime fruits and waffles. It has pool, some people used that (not me). As cons: A long queue to cook waffle, and fruits disappeared very fast.. Long distance to LA (but probably good to local views).

Bottom Line: We will not stay there again.  There are positive and negatives.  Your decision..  Positive 	Room: Very nice with fridge and micro. 	Staff: Friendly 	Breakfast: Good. Toast, cereal, waffles, donuts, orange juice 	Location: Excellent for Knotts Berry. 	If the above are all that is necessary for your stay, then enjoy it.  Negative  .Room security: Most serious negative.  When we returned to room after day out we found door wide open and no-one around.  When I called desk to complain, the response I got was at best an ‘ahhhhhh.’ without an apology or explanation.   As we had computers and tablets on room counter tops I told her this was a serious problem.  Long story short Learned from work crew, not anyone on motel staff, that motel left door open on purpose for

Summary Heading: This is my motel in the LA area
Summary: 20 minutes from LAX.  5 Minutes from Knotts.  10 minutes from Disney.  Shopping and a sportsbar within walking distance.    This hotel is very economical, clean, has a friendly staff and a nice free breakfast in the morning.   It is very close to 91 and a mile from the I-5.   I stay here every time.

Summary Heading: clean, quiet, just what we needed
Summary: This hotel was clean and quiet and just what we were hoping for. Powerful shower, fluffy white towels, huge comfortable bed, fast internet... even decent coffee in the room! Fast, efficient check in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We slept well and woke up refreshed and ready to get back on the road. Would definitely stay again.

This was a pretty good place for the money, the room was well presented and clean, the air conditioner sounded like a jet taking off in your room but that's the only bad thing I can say really. The staff were also very friendly and helpful, definitely recommended for cheap digs in the area.

The only thing I really did not like about my stay was the odor coming from and around the a/c in my room. The bed was alright, pillows could have been better though. The free breakfast was good and consisted of the basics including waffles. Overall, for the price, it's a good budget friendly hotel to stay in and would stay again. Just bring your own pillows and extra blankets.

Summary Heading: Surprised by the Quality for the Price
Summary: Thank you so much for such a wonderful stay. The location is about 30 minutes from the main attractions in Hollywood and literally down the street from Disneyland, awesome location for family trips. Very Clean rooms and Great Staff, I'll for sure be back!

I checked in, and despite the outside appearance of the hotel. The inside was surprisingly good. The room was spacious, comfortable and the hotel wifi was easy to use and plenty fast. The pool area was nice and there was plenty of parking. The one time my key stopped working in the middle of the night, the hotel clerk replaced it quickly.  There is some maintenance going on, but I didn't hear anything. I like that the key is the new fancy technology where you just press it against the key pad. Not clumsy inserts or anything. Plus the location is great for the price. Out of the city. Can't wait to come back.

My family and I plan our annual family vacation to the Los Angeles area, and every year we really like staying here. The hotel staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, are always hospitable. Kirt, the hotel manager is very kind & friendly. He takes the time to ensure his guests stay is pleasant & comfortable. He has a good memory because he remembers my family & their names when we stay here. The rooms are really nice & the beds are so comfortable that we've slept in a couple of times. The pool is fun & the tempurature is on point. We enjoy their breakfast in the morning and the staff there are hard workers & keep it up to par when it gets busy. The food is fresh & delicious with reasonable options. Thank you Kirt & staff for making sure our visit is always enjoyable. We look

We stayed that the Buena Park Hotel and Suites on August 13-21 2016.  We were part of a bus group that came to Anaheim for Disneyland, Universal Studios, SeaWorld, and LEGOLAND.   First of all, breakfast was o.k. - I am a huge breakfast lover... and this continental breakfast was better than nothing, but that's about it.  I ate waffles every day as the doughnuts and other pastries were tasteless.  The orange juice wasn't that great either, but it was o.k.  The location for Disneyland was not convenient.  We found a lot of time was wasted at bus stops and trying to figure out public transit.  I do not recommend this hotel if planning to do a Disney trip!   The restaurants nearby were very good... Outback steakhouse did not disappoint, neither did Rock & Brews... very tasty!  The

Our room was filthy & disgusting! Upon arrival, we found both tub/showers had hair and pink & black mold. The sheets on both beds had hair and clearly been slept in. Called for clean sheets & had to make our own beds. The microwave was dirty with splattered food all over, stained chair, and carpet that was not vacuumed. Complained to front desk. On the second night, we returned very late and found the housekeeper had left the door ajar. The microwave was never cleaned despite our complaints. The carpet wasn't vacuumed until day 3, & the tubs were not cleaned thoroughly ever. Tried to talk to the manager before we left, but he was conveniently busy. He has refused to return our phone calls. Side note...TV was old and scratchy view and their "free wifi" was a joke.

This stay was perfect for what I needed. The hotels location is ideal, theme parks, shopping centers and restaurants all were within walking distance.
