Even if you didn't want to leave the room, the pool/jacuzzi was great. Check in was a breeze. I was there for 4 nights, room was clean and bed was comfortable. Very kid friendly hotel as Disney world is down the street. Also not to far from the hustle and bustle of downtown Los Angeles. Will definitely be staying here again!

Great location walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm. Close to restaurants and convenience stores. kids love it breakfast was included in the price of hotel. We were able to buy the tickets with the concierge for a discount.

This establishment represents itself on its website as a luxury hotel but in reality is shabby and clearly being operated on a shoestring. Evidence of this abounds: chipped paint on battered metal railings, dated and dingy carpet in the rooms and reception and lounge area, no elevator, missing stucco and exposed underlayment on the building walls. Housekeeping seemed limited to making beds and the carpet was not vacuumed. The air conditioner didn't work properly and fresh toiletries weren't provided. The WiFi didn't work and the TV was old, had only a few channels and extremely poor picture quality. The "breakfast" is limited to waffles, bread and cereal. If you want protein and coffee that doesn't come out of a push-button machine, an IHOP is just down the street. In short, if

The room had a refrigerator, microwave and iron. Flatscreen and was located outside of the pool. The location of the hotel in Buena Park is within 5 miles of anything you could need. Hotel front desk was extremely helpful with getting the internet to work and when extending stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Let me tell you my experience so you can go on to the next hotel.went to visitor center to get knotts berry farm tickets.way cheaper than at gate. Employee said she could help us get good hotel for good rate.Only good thing about hotel was it's very close to knotts berry, but also very old and was expensive.absolutely not worth it.I always read reviews so I make a point of going to trip advisor if hotel or restaurant is not good.Too late for me, but I want to save you the time. Happy travels

Summary Heading: Great location and easy to get to.
Summary: Got what we paid for. Nothing fancy, but clean and quite.Beds and beding were above norm. Would stay here again. Plenty to do in area [Knots Berry Farm] lot's of choices for dinning out. Close to Freeway but far enough to be quite.

I didn't even get a chance to stay here because the person who answers the phone didn't hear me so I repeated what I said and then he hung up.  I called again and he just picked up and immediately hung up.  Angry, I kept calling and he kept hanging up.  What kind of people do they have working here?  This must be the kind of place that doesn't screen their employees well which doesn't bode well for travelers' belongings left in the room.  If I were the manager I would fire that person working at 7 pm on 7/19.  That is just bad for business and how many others has this happened to?

Look, this is not a fancy hotel. This is a low priced place to pay your head when in the Knott's/Disney Area. I stayed here with my 3 kids, ages 9 - 12 and it was perfectly acceptable. The front desk staff was also very helpful and courteous. No, this is not high end place. This is a place where families can stay reasonably. My kids loved the pool, too :)

I decided to try a new place to stay and thought this looked good. It wasn't horrible, and not any one big thing was wrong, but lots of little things that added up to that I won't be back. This is an aging property that needs lots of renovation. The first experience is the front desk which is lovely, but that's the only place that's lovely. We stayed 5 nights on the top floor where we experienced soft floors and floor nails that were coming up. There were no usb outlets and 3 outlets for the room. There was a coffee maker but it had to be moved from the vanity area (not enough cord to be plugged in) to the desk where other items had to be unplugged...and it didn't work. Water pressure in the shower was poor at best, and the shower lever had to be wiggled a lot for all the water

Summary Heading: Dirty, bad food, rude staff, loud, gross pool...etc
Summary: This hotel was gross! The pictures are deceiving. It is not a hotel and definitely no suites! This is a MOTEL. They should change their name. There were two days we left later (and I mean like 10 or 11 a.m.) and our hotel room was never cleaned those days. Then we came back later (because we were at Disney, of course) and they said we had to walk all the way around the building to get in, not through the entrance and up the stairs where our room was. We had to drag our tired 6 and 9 year old kids all the way around the gross hotel. Every day around 4:00 the "neighbors" would get up and make a bunch of noise outside our room. It was terribly loud. My son is gluten free and the only thing they had that he could eat was banana's. The coffee was terrible, grossest coffee ever. The

The hotel room was extremely filthy. We walked in and found hair in the bathtub. The towels were filthy. The bed sheets appear to not have been washed in only Lord knows how long. It was completely disgusting. My grandmother booked the room for us and fully paid for it they still needed a $100 deposit only on a debit or credit card would not take cash. which takes at least 3-business days to a week to return to my card while we are traveling. We went to Disneyland park leaving a few belongings including phone chargers and a Hot Spot in our room, in a drawer, underneath clothes. And somehow they still came up missing. While asking the hotel about this issue and how they are going to make it right they advised that they need to be told right away. otherwise they can not make a

The staff here is friendly enough, but this hotel, or rather, motel, has far too many cons outweighing the pros. When we arrived, we were not impressed with the parking lots/building front. Half of the parking lot was roped off with caution tape and cones, which I can understand if they're relaying Tarmac or updating the parking lot, but is it necessary to rope off that much? It doesn't leave many spots left!  We checked in with the lobby, and everything seemed to be going smoothly until we arrived to our room. Part of the light fixture in the bathroom is missing, the air conditioning dials are also missing (and there's a note to use the wall unit instead), and most of the furniture is worn and beaten up. And then, to top it off, the Internet doesn't work. No matter how many

My Friend and I went on a girls trip to see LA for the first time. The trip itself was so much fun but staying so far out of LA was so inconvenient when have to drive to places. The breakfast was the same thing everyday and they had to up grade our room because someone smoked in our non-smoking room. Overall it was a safe place to lay our head but we probably won't stay that far out again.

This is the hotel that I stay when I visit the Los Angeles in Anaheim area. It is only 20 minutes from LAX, has clean comfortable rooms and the staff is very friendly. Disneyland is only five minutes away for you families and Knotts berry farm is almost within walking distance.  The location has an abundance of shopping and restaurants within walking distance as well. The continental breakfast included in the mornings has a wide variety of offerings and good coffee.

I stayed here for 3 nights while traveling to LA for work and it was a great experience! The rooms and bathroom were exceptionally clean and tidy. I particularly appreciated they give you multiple sets of wash cloths and bars of soap, for your face in the sink and for the shower. As a work traveler it was very convenient that they have a reasonably priced laundry room in the hotel, and the front desk staff were very helpful with making change for the washers and getting my WIFI set up.   The whole facility is very So Cal with a big, clean pool in the court yard, breezeways and also secure with a well lit parking lot and cameras.   The hotel is located just north of Anaheim with dozens of bars, restaurants, and shops minutes away. It is a little far out from the downtown LA,

The customer service here is the Worst! Breakfast is bad! The rooms smell gross and the TV's are ancient. You only get three channels. For as much as they charge and make with all the tourist, this place should upgraded. Everything in this hotel needs to be replaced. Next time i will pay a little more for a comfortable stay.

Didnt get to see the pool but the room we had was big enough for a family of 6 (2 to each bed) and plenty of sleeping bag room for bigger families. Had two bathrooms, very clean units and staff was wonderful. On a great strip very close to Knott Berry Farms and other attractions. Good prices (I booked through travelocity). Will definitely stay again!

The location was very convenient and although it was close to the freeway and a busy street, the hotel was pretty quiet. I thought the price was great and I was very pleased with the room. I was traveling alone and felt very safe here. The breakfast was good, can't go wrong with a fresh waffle and some coffee. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The carpet looked newer and the tv was older, but  I didn't mind. Staff was friendly and the lobby was very inviting. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean and Near Knotts berry Farm
Summary: This place was near Knotts berry farm , we walked to the place . But nothing special the breakfast was average .  The room was spacious and clean.  Best way to reach the hotel is to book a rental car and reach because it is quiet far from the airport.

A very decent property with an excellent location. About a mile from Knotts Berry Farm and 5 miles from Disneyland. Lots of decent restaurants in the area too. there is also a mall closeby. Ask for a room away from the freeway.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, very close to Knotts berry farm (10 min walk) and the are places to eat very close by, the rooms were clean and a good size, my only criticism is that we stayed in 2 rooms closest to the main road, this was very noisy at night and I wished I had ask to move to a room at the back of the complex.

well a was good for the money but nothing special  the pool water was very cold the spa was ok but a coat of paint need  the breafsta was ok   close to knoksberry farm only 20 walk    the personnel was great very nice yard with pretty flowers   questo albergo non e niete di speciale ma e un buon prezzo e pulito con piscina e spa e vicino knottsberry farm e soak city

While the personnel were very friendly and our rooms were clean, there were things left to be desired.  The refrigerator in our room has a noisy "clicking" sound when it cycled on, the florescent light in the bathroom took about 5 minutes to warm up and we had to unplug the clock radio because, regardless of what we did (turning down the volume and switching it to MP3 so it wasn't on radio) it would periodically make static noises.  They do have free internet, but, depending on where your room was, it was iffy.

The room was clean and the location was  nice- less than 15mins away from Disneyland. Knottsberry farm is literally around the corner.the front desk staff was nice, the kids enjoyed the free breakfast and pool.

Summary Heading: Good stay for a good price
Summary: Stayed five nights there for a family trip. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful.  The room was clean and the beds were comfy.  TV was old with not much in channel options.  Location was good, close to Knott's as well as a number of restaurant options.  Having access to an on-site laundry room was also a plus.  All in all a good stay and would definitely consider staying there again.

I came here for business in Irvine. I looked at places closer to my destination, but this place was such a better deal, I decided the drive wasn't so bad. I'm so glad I did! It's looks can be a bit deceiving, but the room turned out to be neat as a pin, the bed quite comfortable, & the wifi good! I also never felt unsafe, even coming in late at night. I stayed on the pool side, for the weekend, so naturally it was noisy with kids having the time of their lives. But that all quieted down by nighttime. The breakfast was bagels, cereal, muffins & toast, fruit, & a waffle maker. They had coffee in the room as well as in the lobby. I needed to hang some clothes to take to a meeting & didn't have a car-suitable hanger so I asked the housekeeping staff if they had one I could borrow.

Summary Heading: CLEAN, FAMILY FRIENDLY, BEST LOCATION IN THE AREA
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from March 24 to March 31/16. The hotel is very large and had ample parking. It has free parking, free wifi internet and free breakfast.   The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. Upon arrival, they gave my kids 8 and 6 a small toy gift. It was a small gesture but left a huge impression on my kids who have traveled all over the world and stayed in at least 30 different hotels and this was the first time they received toys on arrival :)  check in was super duper easy, we got there around 8pm and there was no one in the check in. The staff did some paper works, gave us information about the breakfast, our room and provided us the keys and internet password. In addition, they were holding a package that I had mailed to their address before our arrival

Booked a 2 night stay in the 2 queen bed standard room, for the price it's a decent stay. Its clean and has comfy beds. The Wi-Fi was good and strong in my room. They need new tv's though, there's only 10 channels and some didn't even work. I stayed away from the street towards the back and was fairly quiet. It's within 15 min walking to knotts berry farm. There isn't much to breakfast, waffle, juices, muffins, bagels, some fruit. Overall, I would recommend, it's a clean, decent hotel for a few nights rest.

We had a wonderful stay at the Buena Park Hotel. Within walking distance of plenty of fun places like Pirates Dinner Theater, Medieval times, and Knotts Berry farms. Only complaint is that they forgot to empty our trash on one night.

Everything was fine except that there was no protein being served at breakfast. The room was very nice and the cable was ok could be better. The staff was awesome  expescially the lady dana in the food area.

This is now our official hotel whenever we are in the area.  Though housekeeping still leaves a little to be desired, I cannot say enough good things about the administrative/desk staff. They are the best!  This visit, we stayed in a nice room next to the laundry room & pool.  Noise was an issue (as expected), but the room and amenities were very comfortable.  You cannot beat the value & location.  I'm adding new photos...

Very nice property and grounds. I stayed here 2 nights and felt really safe. I was travelling for business but I will definitely come back with my family. Very convenient location. Comfy bed and staff was very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Great stay overall at an excellent price!
Summary: I recently stayed at this property for 9 nights while I was out in LA doing a bunch of shows. I'm a stand-up comic so to be able to have my own bed to go back to rather than crashing on a bunch of couches as I'm used to was great. Overall, my experience at the hotel was excellent. First off, the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. Over the course of my stay I called down to the front desk several times with various questions and the person on the other end of the phone was always very helpful.   The property itself is kept in really good shape. There's a ton of parking, and when you walk in you're greeted by a very bright lobby area (a free continental breakfast and 24 hour coffee is on the other end of the lobby). My room itself was spacious and featured a clean,

Buena Park sits a little bit south of Central LA, but right off of both I-5 and the 91/605, so it's super easy and quick to get anywhere else in the region. The hotel has lots of restaurants, markets, and family friendly activities within a few blocks. Medieval Times was right across the street...um awesome. And yes we did go.  The hotel itself was clean, our room was spacious and nice (two big beds!) and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

We stayed here for 1 night just before Christmas.  We tried to check in very early & they wouldn't do it without a charge, which was no problem.  We asked about leaving our car there, while we went to Knott's Berry Farm & they said that wouldn't be a problem, I dropped off the family & had another family member pick me up there, since it would be a good walk to the park from there.  Upon return that evening, they gave us a free upgrade to a suite, which was great.  Very large room with an extra sitting area & sofa bed.  The bathroom design was great for us to have someone getting ready at the large sink area w/ someone in the toilet/bathtub/shower room.  The beds were comfortable & the room was quiet, even though we were closer to the freeway.  Breakfast was good with waffles,

Here now....  Check in staff was indifferent. Not Rude not friendly- just businesslike. That didn't really bother me but sometimes a good staff can outshine an average room. Not in this case. I would love an average room... This room is less than average. Not the cleanest room I have ever been in. Kids sat on the bed and I made them pull the sheets back first because I just didn't know if it was clean. No shampoo, just lotion and a tiny bar of soap. Paint peeling off the door to bathroom. Just an overall "ick" factor here. I will be up all night worrying If my car is safe. Doesn't seem like a safe part of town.  I was hoping to find a new hotel In Buena Park as we visit frequently, but this is not it. At $160/night, it's not even close to acceptable. Adjusting for the holiday

We had this hotel as our base to visit LA. Rooms were very good and clean. Service was excellent. Breakfast was ok. Our biggest problem with us and this hotel (our fault not theirs) is that because of LA's terrible traffic it took us ages to get there.

Kirt, the manager, and all the front desk staff esp. Ravi, are all very helpful and courteous. Comfy bed, good hot breakfast, very homey atmosphere. The meeting room was also nice for our Bible study.

Excellent service from the start to the end of our holiday.   The room,  was thoroughly cleaned daily - by very friendly staff.  Throughout our stay I didn't spot any bugs in our room.  Breakfast was replenished,  regularly - so everyone had their fill.  Excellent location for heading into LA,  or venturing off to the beaches.  Lots of eateries within walking distance.  I would recommend Buena Park Hotel to everyone

I had a great three-night stay here. The staff was welcoming upon arrival, and I found the room very clean. Though I stayed right off the pool, it was also very quiet, I had no issues napping during the day or sleeping late in the morning. The location is terrific, right by Knott's Berry Farm and right off the highway. Which also makes it convenient to LA, though you will want to avoid rush hour if you want to travel there. The breakfast was good as well. Really no complaints, and it's a good value for the price.

Very friendly management and staff. They were professional and knowledgeable about the area. The property was clean -check in check out was a breeze. Breakfast was fresh and fully stocked. The property was near major roads and major attractions. Lots to do in the surrounding area. Overall this was a nice experience and I would certainly return when back into the area.

Summary Heading: Average Hotel with a good Rate
Summary: We went to Disneyland prior to our stay here so I called to say we would be arriving at Midnight, Upon Arrival there was no one at the front desk, my husband had to pick up desk phone to make it ring and a security showed up. about 15 minutes into it the guy at the front desk came from back room. He put us in a horrible room, Im not sure , it had hairs on the towel on the wall. Morning Came and My husband went down and discussed this and they moved out bags for us while we were gone into a nice room facing the pool that did have a refrigerator, which was needed for medicine for my daughter, We were happy enough with this room that we asked to stay a extra night. Price was good, Breakfast had hot / cold cereals, waffle maker, donuts, muffins, breads, bananas , oranges and juice

The first night was good but the second stay was a complete rip off. Somehow my reservation got "changed" from a suite to a 2 queen and to upgrade it was $50. Amd of course it was too late to cancel the reservation too. Nice way to get people. The rooms are nice. Comfy beds. The outside is under construction. The breakfast is OK. Coffee sucks balls :-/ waffles are good. I guess if you stay here make sure you check your reservation for room type 24 hours prior. I checked before we left on our cruise but when we got back (the day if check in) it was messed up.  Oh well. It was still am awesome vacation and it's right across the street from the pirate dinner and medieval times.

This place seems to continually improve.  Our third stay with Buena Park Hotel & Suites was the best one yet.  My only complaint is that we could not find a check-in time on the website or on our confirmation, or even from the night clerk when we called.  When we arrived we were told that an early check-in would cost $40, and also that there were no rooms available.  It wouldn't usually be an issue, but we wanted to attend events at 1:00 & 6:00, and had to get ready for event #1 in our car, and check-in between events.    The clerks were all very kind and accommodating.  They even unlocked the bonus room & extra bathroom in our suite, probably because they knew we were inconvenienced with the check-in time.    The room was clean and the a/c unit was running when we arrived.  The

We stayed here for one night on the way to San Diego. The hotel is very close to freeway and easy to find. The room was clean and spacious. The breakfast could be better if they have some hot items like eggs or sausages, but no complaints here. Overall, it is good for a night sleep.

Very clean, housekeeping does a great job. I arrived on a Sunday and asked to see a room and was impressed with the cleanliness  and decor and checked in. I told mgmt I could possibly be there 7 days but for sure 4 nights and if plans changed I would notify them early Thursday  morning and it was agreed upon. Thursday I called to say I would be there through Saturday night and check out Sunday. I was told I could stay Friday night but Saturday was booked. I asked what happened to our arrangements?  I could immediately tell there was no bargaining even after nearly 1000.00 dollars spent. Extras such as snacks are very high so stop at a store. One individually wrapped cookie is 2.50 dollars. On site laundry priced good. 1.50 to wash and 1.00 for 30 minutes on the dryer which drys

Comfortable room. Very helpful and friendly staff , great gift shop and helpful advice for us to save money and what we can walk to from our hotel and bus info. We loved the pool and hot tub. 5 nights and 6 days been to Knots Berry Farm in walking distance and bused to Disney . Lots of great fun eating places and shopping up or down from the hotel.

For 46 dollars a night this was the best. It was 5 miles from Disney and 2 minutes from Knotts berry. It doesn't look like much but I'd highly recommend it. The furniture is new and so is the carpet but it doesn't look like much from the outside which is why it's surprising. As well they do have free breakfast where you can make your own waffles which is fun for the kiddies

Summary Heading: excellent value! Walking distance to everything
Summary: Walking distance to Medieval times, Bodies, Pirates, Titanic, & Knotts. Quick commute to Anaheim and cheaper than Anaheim area. Approx 1.5 hour commute to SeaWorld. Nice breakfast setup with make your own waffles, donuts, muffins, juice, coffee, bagels, etc. Many of teh rooms already upgraded, seems like they are working hard on the rest. Excellent value for my $! I have stayed here 3 times with my kids and they keep asking to stay here...

Summary Heading: bad customer service overshadows decent accommodations.
Summary: Just checked out this morning stayed for 2 nights. 2 adults, 2 kids . After the room next to us decided to have a rave i finally called and front desk knew about it and called the police. unfortunately the police are the only ones apperantly that can "evict" a guest from a room. so after 2more hours of over 14 ppl in- out and in the parking lot partying police broke up the party. After inquiring about it couple hours later at the front desk. I was told they were gone.   I asked for an extra towel since my reservation was for 4 and only had 3 towels. Inquired about any kind of compensation or the neighbors my family had to put up with . I was told the notes were there and manager would look at it.  Fast forward to 12:30 am after a long day at disney go back and mind you were in
Manager Response: Matthew, I sincerely apologize for the disturbance that you had to endure during your stay.  I was advised of the situation at home while it was going on.  I contacted the security company that we work with and due to the fact that there were several individuals involved and the security officers were out numbered, in the interest of everyone's safety it was best to wait for the police.  I also called and spoke with the dispatch center and it was a particularly busy night and they dispatched officers as soon as possible.  I don't want you think that we weren't trying to address the situation and get the offending individuals off the premises.    I will share your comments with our housekeeping department and stress that it is important to fully stock the guest rooms with the proper amount of towels.  Likewise I will stress to the front desk to make sure that guest room keys are made for the proper amount of days so that other gusts do not have to experience what you went through.  As for the lack of an appropriate apology upon check out, I am embarrassed and upset.  I do not tolerate the type of behavior that you experienced from any of our guests.  I know that when you are traveling with your family you want a safe, quiet, comfortable property and a guest room that fully meets your needs.  You have my belated and sincere apology for what happened.  I have identified your booking and will be in touch with your agent to refund one night back to you as compensation.  Please feel free to contact me if I can be of further service.

Summary: Three adults and 3 children stayed here to go to Knotts Berry Farm. It was walking distance for us.  Excellent room (suite)  Living room, with sofa bed, bed room with two queen beds plus two full bathrooms.  Two televisions.  Very large room.

I like this hotel's location and atmosphere and services and staff and most importantly, value.  I know what I'm going to get and it is consistent on every visit.   With it's location about a mile from Knott's Berry Farm,  and five miles from Disneyland , this motel is family friendly.    A continental breakfast is provided in the morning with some healthy alternatives.   The I-91 is a block away and I-5 is 2 miles from the entrance.  LA downtown is only 30 minutes away and LAX is 27 minutes.    Of course I'll stay here again!

The room wasn't perfect, we experienced some WiFi and a/c problems, but the stay was comfortable. Breakfast was great!   Since the price was so good I think you get a superb value for your money staying here.   The staff was very nice too. We were booked for three nights but decided to leave after two, since when we booked we didn't realize it was located so far away from places we were going to visit. This was no problem for them. We didn't have to pay a "leave early fee", we didn't even have to pay for the last night (We got a refund for that night).

Wonderful friendly service.  I left my purse in lobby by accident, he found it and it was waiting for me when I came back down.  Treated my children to a little free candy. Very impressed.  Courteous staff. Nice continental breakfast.

The hotel is average. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly. I stayed there with just myseld and my 3 children. I felt safe. The rates are very reasonable and the location is ideal. Close to Knotts and the dinner adventure shows (walking distance). Nothing spectacular, nothing terrible. The breakfast was good. I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for the price,well located.
Summary: Location of this hotel is great and easy to find. It doesn't look much on the outside but is a bit better on the inside. Check-in staff are friendly. The rooms are a decent size although dated(the t.v and air conditioning unit are ancient) and ours overlooked the pool. This is nice to be able to watch the kids in the pool, but not so great in the morning when people insist on shouting(rather than just talking) at each other at breakfast. The breakfast needs a little reorganising as at present the queue to get breakfast gets so long because of people waiting for waffles. Its an average breakfast, but free. The pool and hot-tub is an added bonus for the kids with plenty of loungers and chairs around. My only thought was on arriving after 10pm they lock all the doors into reception

I checked in, and despite the outside appearance of the hotel. The inside was surprisingly good. The room was spacious, comfortable and the hotel wifi was easy to use and plenty fast. The pool area was nice and there was plenty of parking. The one time my key stopped working in the middle of the night, the hotel clerk replaced it quickly.  I tried to check in at 1pm, they said I couldn't check in until 3pm. I asked if there was any way I could check in early or if they could move around my reservation. They didn't even look at the computer and immediately said they were sold out last night. The parking lot was quite empty, but that's fine.  I went to a movie up the street, and there were plenty of food options. I came back at 3:30 ish. Checked in. I laid down for a nap once I

The Buena Park Hotel and Suites provides incredible customer service. The management and staff go above and beyond to ensure their guests are cared for. The general manager is very hands on  and is really helpful. I will definitely refer my colleagues to this property.  Thanks again Buena Park Hotel and Suites for a fantastic experience.

The Buena Park Inn and Suites was comfortable, clean and close to restaurants and attractions. It had an affordable coin-operated laundry, which was convenient,  as we were there for 3 nights. We enjoyed relaxing in the hot tub, which was the perfect temperature.

Great experience! Delicious breakfast! Loved the pool and felt safe with having a 2 yr old and a 9 yr old. Staff was really cool to get to know and they were very accommodating. This hotel is conveniently located near plenty of places to visit, explore, and enjoy. Thank you Buena Park Hotel!

We stayed here for a basketball tournament. Slow check in process, when we did get to our room. Blood stains on the sheets , and other bed had dirt on it. They did get us another room though. The two ice machines at the hotel did not work the entire time we were here.

our family has been coming to this hotel for so many years and to our surprise management has changed and we were treated as if we were nobody our room was given away for arriving late and then management and counter raised the prices according to them peak season before we never was worried about it cause we had been faithful for so many years now they don't even care their rooms are losing beauty and they are lacking cleaning the exterior sorry but we have decide to change hotels

There is a lot I can say in review of my stay here at this hotel, but mainly there was a problem with the financial part of it.  I had bought my ticket through the link of cheaptickets and I was charged differently off that link then when I went in person and the front desk assistant gave me my receipt.  They had given me a total that was 100 dollars less than what I had already agreed through the cheaptickets site. I thought, wow awesome! But after leaving it wasn't so awesome because my card got charged by the cheaptickets site AND the hotel separately. So in calling to get a refund from cheaptickets, the person on the other line informed me that the employee at the hotel disclosed the cheap price that was actually only between the cheaptickets company and the hotel; a price

Summary Heading: Buena Park Hotel great stay from Elijah Howard
Summary: The Buena Park Hotel & Suites is a great place for familys and a single person traveling. I enjoyed the clean atomsphere and great customer service the free breakfast was nice perk of the hotel! being close to shopping, parks, and good dinning makes this Hotel high on my recommendation list.....and its a very safe area!

I was very impressed with Buena Park Hotel--it far exceeded my expectations. We checked in close to midnight, and the customer service when I arrived was excellent. The representative quickly processed my information and did so very kindly. Our room was clean and comfortable, complete with a fridge and microwave, which was very useful. We slept well, as it was very quiet--far enough from the highway to not have extra noise.   In the morning, there were plenty of options included with the free continental breakfast. Though, it would have been good to offer more protein choices (even if just yogurt) as the selections were all high carbohydrate choices, like bagels, donuts, and cereal. The buffet was kept well-stocked, accommodating dozens of families that must have been staying

I believe this hotel was 3 stars because Inside of the room was big & freshly painted. The bathrooms were dirty with about an inch of crud around the edge and thick scum around the drain. someone had at some point tried to kick in the door with damage and pieces missing all along the bottom. The security lock had been cut off and never replaced, with big gaps around the door. I called for a pillowcase at 7pm and 9pm but it never arrived. we checked out the next morning and moved on to another hotel.

Room was in sore need of carpet cleaning. Shower was clean but needed resurfacing. Linen clean but worse for wear. Staff were very friendly and apologetic.  Lots of great eateries within walking distance. All hotels in the area seemed exhausted from wear. Do not let the hotel pics fool you. Caution, you will get less than you pay for at this hotel!

Me and my family stayed at Buena Park back in April of 2015. Initially, I was uncertain about staying here due to some of the reviews posted. However, I decided to take the chance since we wanted to stay in Buena Park (perfect location, close to all the attractions!). We were pleasantly surprised to have a very clean room, clean bathrooms. Buena Park recently went through some renovations. We stayed in a room that had new mattresses (yes I check mattresses regardless of where I stay). The front staff service was nice. We did not have time to survey the property or use any of the amenities on the property. We stayed in a family suite so there was enough room for our whole family to stretch out and sleep comfortably. For the price you may, this is a great budget-friendly to stay

Never felt like anyone was glad we were there. Our room was way in the back away from everything. No ice machine close, pool too far away for us to walk to, one old tv with about channels in a family suite, everything dated. My kids took showers and not enough shampoo for them all! Then a little while later their feet were black from the carpet! Stayed down the street last year for a little more and it was out of this world! We wont be back!! Get ready Best Host Inn were coming back!! Sorry we ever left!

Summary Heading: My first pick when I come to the LA area
Summary: Great from check-in to check out.   Great location in a safe business area.  Right off the 91 and 1/2 mile from I-5.   Knotts Berry Farm a three minute drive and Disney is less than 10 minutes away.   LAX 23 minutes.    The room was clean.  Free wifi, complimentary breakfast (with fruit available) in the morning.  The pool is privately located in the middle of the grounds.

We had a blast at The Buena Park Hotel & Suites! The room was very nice and clean, and the continental breakfast always had a big selection, plus the waffles were to die for. Very close to the Disneyland Resort, which was our main focus for the trip and even though it's located right off the freeway, we always felt safe.

I recently stayed at the Buena Park hotel and I gotta say they went above and beyond! The room was really clean, friendly staff, free breakfast, and it's a great location! Thanks for everything, I'll be back! 7555 Beach Blvd, Buena Park, CA is the place you wanna stay.

Decent place for the price. The staff is great. All we were there was to sleep. Tvs are old but we were never in the room. Breakfast was excellent but kinda cramped and hectic. Breakfast area needs to be bigger with more tables.. The location is great close to everything. The pool was very nice but spa was cramped at times. The beds are great. For $42.00 a night I would highly recommend this hotel as long as you book the suite. This is our second stay and will stay here again for the price.

I booked this place thinking it was nice. The rooms were descent the tv was pretty old though. Housekeeping came after 4 which was late because we had come back from our errands so we didnt get it done because we wanted to rest. They have a variety of free breakfast unfortunately it was super packed so we didnt even enjoy our breakfast. Our key didnt work so everyday we had to go to the office to get it fixed. The rooms were clean and the beds and the bathroom no complain there. It was an average stay.

I don't know if we stayed in a nicer room this time, or if there have been some changes made, but this visit was much nicer than our previous ones (not that those were bad to begin with).  The room, while dated, was very clean and comfortable.  The staff were some of the nicest that we have met.  The continental breakfast is the second best that we've found in the area.  The location is excellent for Medieval Times or the Pirate Adventure Show, and about a ten minute drive to Disneyland (back roads, forget the highway!).  They had a strong & easy-to-use Wifi signal.  All of the in-room appliances worked well.  The spa was broken, but we still enjoyed the warm water & the pool.  Buena Park Hotel & Suits made our vacation quite enjoyable and stress-free.  We will be back!

I wanted the cheapest hotel I could find that had a clean bed.  This hotel ended up being both!  I paid around $50 for one night and the bed was comfortable (not amazing) and clean.  The hotel also had a decent WiFi connection (4 MB download/.5 MB upload).  There was a continental breakfast, but there was no protein on the menu.  But hey, it was $50!  The hotel was nothing special, but it was sufficient and it was a fair price.  I would stay here again, if I just needed a night's rest.  A warning about the noise level: The walls of the rooms are very thin and it is located about 100 ft away from the freeway. Considering the amount of traffic in LA and the proximity to the freeway, there was constant noise all night long.  You can also here people coming in and out of the other

I participated in the Inside Jokes comedy festival and decided to stay at Beuna Parks Hotel & Suites on the recommendation of the festival organizer. I have to say after spending a little under a week there that is was an excellent choice!  The rooms were very clean and room service was very unobtrusive. They refilled all our shower items (soap, shampoo, etc) without having to be asked, which is something that always annoys me about other hotels when you have to go to the front desk and beg for toiletries.   The hotel had a pool and a hot tub. They were both very clean and due to the hotel not being INSANELY huge, it never felt over crowded. The hotel is located near several nice restaurants and attractions. I didn't get a chance to check out Knott's Berry Farm but it's nearby

This hotel was wonderful - we were producing a huge comedy festival in Los Angeles, and they treated all of our comedians so well. Everyone enjoyed their stay, and I'd like to recommend it to everyone else! We will happily use them again in the future.

Clean, staff was extra friendly and helpful, free breakfast & my room was nice & cozy.  I walked past the starbucks on my way to iHop in the ams and I visited Laguna Beach from here.  Drive was between 25-30 miles from where I was going in LA but worth it.  Will def visit again and will recommend to friends.  Lots of families there when I was there.

Just because you add "suite" to your name doesn't mean you should charge more than the motel 6 rate its worth. The air filter in the ac filter in the unit was filth and fell apart when taken out to clean. Just a run down sort of place. Won't stay here again.

Great 3 night stay no noise, close, shops and great service. Highly recommended to my comedy brothers & sisters. Breakfast offered with nice clean rooms. Great for a family vacation or short get away.

The room was clean & staff was helping in every way to correct little problems.  Our phone did not work in the room, had to plug & unplug because of blinking light that would not go off. Hotel was close to everything we wanted to do & under $65.00 a night.

For a family of five, the space in our suite was perfect (as was the price). We had a bedroom with 2 comfortable queen beds and a separate LR with a sofa bed.  Room was clean, had 2 bathrooms, microwave and fridge.  TV was a disappointment.  After long day at the park, dinner and swimming, there was no unwinding in front of the TV because we got only one local channel and some Spanish speaking channels.  Don't think it was connected to satellite or cable.  In addition, the TV's were too old for the kids' to be able to connect their video game boxes.  That was mildly annoying but not a deal breaker.  Our biggest complaint was the NOISE.  The building that houses the suites sits next to the freeway.  The NOISE is constant - 24/7 constant.  The suites on the courtyard side of the

Summary Heading: Average for a two-star hotel - don't count on wi-fi or tv, breakfast above average but busy, convenient location
Summary: Keep in mind, the overall rating on this hotel is 3.5 out of 5. Now that's 3.5 when compared to other two-star hotels, not three-star, four-star, or five-star.  I would have given it 4 but my room key deactivated a day early, which is a known problem that should have been addressed. Otherwise, breakfast was above average for a two-star, staff was mostly kind, location and rate was excellent, accommodations were average. Right across the street from Pirate's Dinner Adventure, less than 1/2 mile from Target, about a mile from Knott's, right next to Outback. Paid just over fifty a night for four nights.  First day: check in took 20 minutes because two people were ahead of me. Room was a little run down but mostly clean and well sized. We had only one wash cloth for a two-queen

Summary Heading: Bring your own towels and ice
Summary: On Friday night we checked into our hotel seemed like a pretty decent place, staff was very friendly and breakfast area looked nice. Our hotel room was all the way on the other side had to park very far and not enough light In-between the buildings. Room was ok just a bit older, ver frustrating that the tv only had 5 channels and the rest were blank. Saturday morning we went for breakfast it was so crowded because everyone was waiting for waffles that we couldn't get to the anything else. The coffee was horrible tasted like it sat there all night.  Saturday night the kids wanted to play in the "game room" it was only 3 games and the quarter machine didn't even work. When we asked the clerk at the desk a very nice man said he was sorry that only the guy at the mini store had keys

Summary Heading: Clean room, comfortable beds and friendly staff.
Summary: Very clean with very comfortable king size beds. Spacious and affordable! The free breakfast every morning was amazing! Vending and ice machines were also fair. Very clean outdoor pool and spa. Overall great place to stay for the $!

Summary Heading: Clean room, comfortable beds and friendly staff.
Summary: So nice to check into a room and everything is clean and works well. The volume on the TV would only go halfway down but nothing too important. My son loved the motels arcade. One machine with multiple games, (Donkey Kong, DK Jr., Centipede, Galaxian, to name a few) a driving game and a few other including a pool table. The hot tub was warm and filled with bubble when we turned it on. The pool wasn't heated so it was pretty cold but again, not as important and the rooms and beds. Place was busy so did hear a lot of beeping and honking from people setting their alarms. Location was great with a Outback next door and a Burger King on the other side. Even a Starbuck within walking distance for our morning coffee. Knott's Berry Farm is just a few blocks away. Noticed staff

I would rate this as a "3 circle" property, for good accommodations.  I probably would have gone with 4, but there were a few flaws that knocked them down a notch.  I would note that this is not a hotel, it's a motel, with cars parking right in front of the room doors in a good portion of the property.  The corridors are on the exterior, and you can hear people walking and talking just outside your door and window (the windows are single pane glass). There was also a 3/4" gap under the door lets in light and noise.  You'll hear car doors slamming and engines starting at all hours.  You may have more peace and quiet with a room that faces the pool, unless the weather is warm enough for kids to be in the water.  The bathroom in my room looked like it had been modernized a bit.

Arrived with a bus full of high school students after the check-in time. Upon arrival, our rooms had not yet been keyd by the front desk, which was a little frustrating. The woman at the front desk worked quickly to get all rooms keys ready, yet I felt that should have been done before our arrival.  The rooms are difficult to locate and the front office was not helpful at all in physically showing us in which direction we needed to go. Rather, she kept pointing in the direction, yet I was still confused. I would recommend that you leave your bags and items in your vehicle until you have located your room, then unload your belongings. I helped a lady carry her very heave bag up the stairs, only on the other side to help her lift it down the stairs as she went to the wrong level

Checked in, dropped off my bags, went out to the beach ... Came back around 10, hopped in bed. By 1:15am I was at LaPalma Hospital covered in a horribly itchy rash that lasted my entire stay.  The manager kindly had my sheets changed. The rash didn't go away until I checked out.  Use less chemicals in your laundry or clean better. Vacay. Ruined.

Summary Heading: Only a good place for one night.
Summary: We have been here for almost a week and have not had a very good experience. I don't think it has been a good value at all. The first night we were checked in to a dirty room then sent to a room that already had guest then told that our additional  upgrade cost would be copmt but our room wouldn't be ready till the next day so we stayed in a standard room next day we were again sent to two more rooms before it got straightened out. The room itself was nice we got a family suite and it was perfect size for our family. However our room was never stocked with towels or coffee or even cleaned. We have been constantly having to go to the front to stock our own room. We even didn't have toilet paper one night. Whenever I call the front desk to tell them we don't have things in our

This property is very old.  The "newly renovated rooms"  were not evident to me.  The rugs were very dirty.  The tub had rust stains around the drain.  The bottom sheet near the pillows had a piece of candy, apparently dropped by housekeeping personnel. Some breakfast items were not available.  No cream cheese for bagels and no butter,  only spread.  Coffee wasn't terrific, either, no cream, just chemical creamer.  No refrigerator or microwave.  I really think that the above mentioned complaints are things that are pretty much standard in the hotel industry now.  There was a wadded up piece of paper behind the bathroom door when we arrived.  We stayed there 2 nights and it was still there when we left.  Why did we stay?  No other place to book.  Big tournament at Cal State

I didn't book this hotel, my cousin did and didn't really know what to expect. Lobby looks really old and hotel definitely needs some work.  Rooms look like they have had a little work done. Washroom needs work for sure. Cracks in the sealing for the tub. Best thing about the room is that there is 2 rooms, so each bed is in it's own room. Beds are not bad either. Lots of room. Staff was friendly as well.    I'm giving it 3 "circles" because of the friendly staff and the fact that for what it is, it did the job.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value and Great Customer Service
Summary: I travel quite a bit, and for more than 30 nights each year, I'm sleeping away from home. Orange County is a home away from home for at least once or twice a year.  Having friends that live there, I'm not looking for anything too fancy or pricy.   This property is very fairly priced, and with the rates comparable to Motel 6 / Super 8, I thought we'd give it a try.  Our stay was for 3 nights. I found the location VERY good, located off Beach Blvd, walking distance to Buena Park attractions (Knott's Berry Farm, etc.), restaurants and shopping.  I rent a car when I'm down there, and there is ample parking and a short distance to two major freeway exits. The rooms are clean, and I found them in different stages of renovation. The beds are super comfortable and there are bar fridges

Easy to get to and not far from Anaheim Convention Center and Disney.  Very close to knotts Berry Farm.  I traveled for Business so I did not go to these parks.  Rooms were clean and newly renovated and bed was comfortable.  TV was old CRT type and not HD.  Not many outlets so I had to charge my phone in the bathroom.  WiFi was slow/non-existent.  Could only get on briefly and did not have a cable to plug into the wall (although I don't know if this even worked)  Noise a bit of an issue.  With the walkway directly outside the door, people walked by all the time.  Got more quiet around 11PM.  I didn't feel comfortable opening my window shades since passersby could just look in and see inside.    Breakfast was just OK.  Standard fare but waffle was OK but no butter, only "spread".

Summary Heading: Excellent value near Disney/Knotts Berry Farm!
Summary: This motel is only a couple of miles from the parks.  It's clean, has state of the art door locks, fridge, microwave, breakfast and is in a safe neighborhood/atmosphere.  The staff was friendly.  I-5 is only a mile away.  LAX is only 20 minutes away.  LA Angles 12 minutes away.  For the $ you can't find a better value and stay in a safe atmosphere.  I stay in 30 plus hotels/motels a year.  This is very acceptable.    I would recommend to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Just ok, not for long stays
Summary: We stayed only for a weekend, the hotel has a certain old moldy smell, the rooms seem to have been updated recently, but still TV was old and had only 11 channels.  Bathroom shower head has good pressure,  the staff is not the friendliest. The hotel is just ok, a bed to spend the night, nothing more nothing less.   We didnt try the breakfast nor the pools as it was chilly

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staffs & very comfortable bed
Summary: Hotel's location is great, right next to 91 freeway. 10 minutes walk to Knott's Berry Farm and around 15 minutes drive to Disneyland.  It was newly remodeled, room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. Family had a good stay and definitely will return again while around.

The hotel is at an excellent location closed to many restaurants, Knott’s Berry Farm, Disneyland and with easy access to Freeway.  The rooms are clean, shower has nice running hot water, the price is very reasonable and it included breakfasts!  Parking is free.  In addition, there are many different room options that would fit different families’ needs.  My wife and I stayed in a room with two queen beds.  We enjoyed our stay, the evening was very quiet without people running around or making noises.

Great location, very close to Knott's Berry Farm. Only 10 minutes drive from Disneyland. Room was very nice and clean.. Free continental breakfast just what we need. Can not ask more for this price.  We will come back again next year.

In fact, the only good of this hotel is having a place to sleep.  The hotel is divided in two sections, one main section near the front desk and the other one at the rear of it; far from everything (which unfortunately was the place of my room). First, the bathroom only had hot and super hot water, which was a problem; every time that we tried to have a bath. I reported this to the front desk, and the option they found was closing the super hot water key.   Then we went to a theme park when we returned (near 22:00 hrs); we weren’t able to enter our room. I had to go with rain to the front desk to check what seems to be the issue. The guy at the front desk just told me that they were going to change us from room, but didn’t tell us until we returned and that we have to move all

Stayed here late summer. Great Location! Knott's very close. Eating and variety of stores very close. This was a last minute booking so was not sure what to expect. The lobby/breakfast area is a bit outdated, however rooms have been updated. Only issue with rooms is no flat screen TV and poor wifi. The overall hotel is very clean. Breakfast is typical hotel breakfast, but seating is limited. Pool area and hot tub very nice. Pool was warm hot tub a bit too cool. You get what you pay for, not glamorous but suitable and clean with good staff service.

I'd like to say some things just can't be helped and then some things can.  The location was less than 10 minutes to Disneyland.  It was very easy to get to.  Check in was ok-they said we didn't have a reservation but then I produced the receipt.  They need a new reservation agent.  The room appeared clean but there was a musky, mildewy smell.  Room was spacious.  Bed was comfortable, pillows were great!  Walls were very thin and we had horrible neighbors.  Sink was clogged but they immediately sent someone to fix it.  We never saw breakfast because we were going to Disneyland.  Don't get the 300 section if you're a light sleeper because its near traffic.  Id stay there again.

I gave my adult children 2 nights here as a gift. Before they got there, I called and asked how this would work-I put the cost on my credit card, but I would not be there--I gave this as a gift. I was told by the hotel to call the company I made the reservations with. I did, reservations.com faxed a message to the hotel, adding my son's name and that he had permission to check in. When my son got there, he was told "NO" this was wrong. He even had a copy of the confirmation email.  I had to call Expedia because this hotel does not work with the company that made the reservations. I called Expedia--the lady was VERY helpful. She said they do not work with this hotel. She called my son and the front desk and explained that it was reservations.com that had to "OK" this arrangement.

We stayed as a couple, but would definitely suggest for families looking to see the area. The hotel entrance is right off the main highway with easy in & out / lft & rt. Across from Medieval Times & Pirate's Dinner Show, next to Outback, BK, and others at a walkable distance. Convenience is the main asset here. Disney was a 10 minute drive & Knott's BF is just a couple of blocks away. Hotel bed was super comfy, staff was very attentive, and our room on inner courtyard was very quiet during late hours when we needed sleep. Hot tub & pool with lounge chairs ... picnic tables which will be upgraded to patio sets, they told us. Breakfast has great choice of juice & coffee is better than many hotels we've stayed in - here's why: Nestle coffee creamers! Reg & Hazel. The donuts are

Very standard motel room. Pretty clean, and very close to our destination (Knotts Berry Farm). The staff were courteous, but a little overwhelmed, They provided the thinnest soap for washing -- one bar was only enough for 2 washes (maybe they meant that to be a one use item?)  One issue we encountered was opting to use agoda.com. The hotel told us that it would be a long wait, and that we might not have a room (even though we booked and paid through the site). They did end up honoring the booking, but it was added stress we didn't need. We had tried to book through their website, but it kept crashing. When we were at the hotel, they told us that their website booking hasn't worked for weeks and that we needed to call to make a reservation (very old-school).  Another issue was

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy... a place to sleep
Summary: This hotel is more like a motel,  but at $60/night,  I won't complain.  Each room had a coffee pot (although the glass was broken on mine). The rooms were clean.  And yes,  tv was def out of date.  But i didn't go for the tv.  It's located directly across the street from Pirates, and hop,  skip,  & jump away from Medieval times.  Outback was next door, and burger King was next to that.  Can't beat the location.   The pool and hot tub were already back in order by the time we stayed (as I heard they had been under construction). Wish we would have taken our suits so the kids could've used the hot tub.   Continental breakfast was a bit chaotic.  The waffle station takes forever,  and the other options are cereal,  a fruit,  and other carbs like donuts & and muffins.  We ate there

The location for this hotel is great.  One of the staff members was rude.  He wasn't wearing a name tag.  Anyway, the TV was an ancient one and had no remote.  The exhaust fan in the bathroom was noisy.  I told a couple of maintenance men and the lady that checked me out.  They were all nice but the one at check-in.  The breakfast was crowded as there are not enough tables and chairs.  A $200 deposit was required for some reason.  They gave it back but did not check anything first.  This was not an overall pleasant experience,

Summary Heading: Good hotel. Great location. Excellent Staff.
Summary: Gotta love it.  All the things you would want from a hotel. Great location across the street from Medieval Times and a short walk to Knott's Berry Farm. This hotel has one of the friendliest staffs I have ever encountered, the gift shop has a variety of good snacks and the game room has a pool table And a Mortal Kombat 3 console. I spent more than a few quarters. I also liked the fact that the hotel was nice and quiet at night. No late night partying as far as I could tell.  Oh, and the Waffle bar is delicious.  And if you are still one of those people that smokes (I am) , they still have smoking rooms available. I really enjoyed my stay, and I can't wait to go back.

I planned a last minute trip to Knott's Berry Farm and booked this hotel the day before (first time ever booking this last minute). I needed a budget friendly place that was close to the theme park. Most reviews were not welcoming, however I found the most recent reviews to be more on the better side. We weren't looking for a 4/5-star hotel but rather a nice place to sleep without hurting our wallet.   After our visit to the park, we checked in late into the hotel (around 9pm). I was greeted by a male behind the counter. Though there were others in front of me, he checked me in quickly. He also explained the internet and breakfast to me as well. He was very friendly.  I'm not sure why but when I opened the door to the room, we were given a mini-suite. It had the two-queen beds I

Summary Heading: Great stay, great location,  best price!
Summary: Choose to stay here because of the reviews, and glad I made the choice. A block and half away from Medieval Times and about 4+ blocks frim Knotts Berry Farms. Room/bath were nice and clean. Nice beds with lots of pillows. Pool was still open(late November) Continental breakfast was good and well replenished.  Front desk staff was nice and helpful.   CON: I booked through Tingo.com and after I was disappointed and frustrated to find out they don't accept booking through them. (Booked from outside the hotel) after getting in contact with Tingo they are returning my funds.    Booking.com took literally like 5mins for the hotel to get the fax!!!

I have stayed at this Hotel many times for years although managment has changed from time to time I have always had the best experience. This last time we visited the Hotel many changes it has been remodeled and looks very nice. The receptionist Veronika had awesome customer service and made sure my family and I were Happy with our stay. No complaints at all and I will definetly be returning.... Thank you Veronika you and your staff are all so Great!! :)

In my books would have been a 5 but internet was absolutely crap. Rooms were comfortable and quiet stay. Very close to Knotts berry farm, price excellent, so thumbs up for that. Would stay again but do not rely on the wifi.

My band played a gig in Long Beach on 11/09. My friend Adam Wagner from Ignite Hospitality found us two very nice rooms at this hotel. Great call Adam! Not only was the hotel reasonably close to our gig, it was right in the heart of everything that is going on in that area. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. What impressed me the most was the very helpful and friendly staff. I would like to personally thank the hotel manager Kirt Chrisenson and his staff Veronica, Ravi, Chirac who ran to my rescue when my key didn't work for making our stay very pleasant. I wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy the very nice swimming pool and the friendly atmosphere. The complementary breakfast in the morning was also a plus. The stay was great and I also made some new friends.

We needed a room for the night after an L.A. Kings game on Nov 8th as we live a couple of hours away.  I called about 11 days prior to book the room and requested a downstairs room and a fridge for my insulin.  Due to a medical condition I needed the downstairs room and was told upon booking that it would not be a problem.  I booked another hotel for the same night and waited until the second to the last day to cancel one just in case there were any problems.  I called on Thursday to confirm that we indeed had a downstairs, non smoking room with a fridge and was reassured by Nat that we did.  I then canceled my other room.  We arrived at 3:20 on the 8th and once again asked if our accomodations were what we had requested, we were told yes, as we were given the room key with #268

Summary Heading: Good Price and Right Across From Knotts
Summary: The hotel is older and could use an upgrade, but for the price and location it was a good deal. It is located right across from Pirates Dinner, Knotts and the other attractions are really close too. One thing that I think they need to work on is towel counts tho, they had 3 bath towels in the room but no wash cloths or hand towels.

We stayed here in Oct 12-16th for $250, that's with taxes and fees, out the door, with a fri & sat night involved. Steal of a deal. Hotel from the outside didn't look all that great, but inside lobby was real nice. Check in for a breeze, kids asked for a top floor overlooking pool, which they said was no problem. Everyone that worked there was real friendly. Beds were comfy, free breakfast was good, nothing fancy. Only reason I didn't rate higher was pool was not heated, and t.v. could use updating. Otherwise, kids said they wouldn't mind staying again, and either would I for the price.

My friends & I planned a trip to Buena Park to attend Knott's Scary Farm and this is literally walking distance to Knott's, Medieval Times, and Pirates. It's located right off the 91 (close freeway access). The check-in process was smooth, the front desk clerk was very professional & courteous.  We stayed in the Valencia Suite (Room 406) which is Northwest of the lobby. You don't hear the freeway from your room, but you could hear the people talking in the hallway as they pass your room. The room was clean, the beds and couches were comfortable. The shower only had one temperature and it was warm/hot.   The staff who brought us extra towels and blankets were very polite. They have a security guard who does rounds to make sure everything is covered.   There's only 1 ice machine

Summary Heading: Not bad for a last minute reservation!
Summary: We were very pleased when we made a last minute reservation here. I had stayed at the Courtyard just down the street before and had MASSIVE issues, so we decided to try this place. They are in the process of updating this hotel and what they had already finished (lobby area) was very nice. The rooms are older, but as I said, its being updated. The morning breakfast was great and the staff were friendly. My only problem was our room keys didn't work half the time. I would recommend this hotel over others in the area because not only was it reasonably priced (and they gave us a military discount), but its in a great location and close to Knotts Berry Farm.

Summary Heading: Ok for a last minute reservation...
Summary: First off... Only stay here if you have no other choice! The guy who checked me was nice and very helpful but once I got into the room that's when things went down hill. The room looked clean at first glance but then I noticed the hair on the ground. There were clumps of hair all over the bathroom floor and bathtub. My hair is dark brown and this hair was a mixture of red and blond!! It was really gross.   There were lots of strange people just hanging around outside and at really odd hours. And you can hear everything outside. I doesn't help that there was a gap between the door and the floor. It had to be about an inch gap. So that made the noise outside even clearer. There was even trash just sitting outside our room. It was there from when we arrived till we left at almost

they have old keys ( chiped style) that would cost $10  dollar if lost or broken. I attending Knotts Scarry Farm where i could have lost it or broke it. They need to switch to the updated key cards.  had no Large towels appraintely a large group took the towels the night before and they need washing. went back after getting back from knotts they gave me small towels.  Nice Clean room, comfortable bed, Freindly and professionable Staff, Very nice lobby. Right off the 91freeway, close to Knotts.  small complaints - Toilet bowl seat was bloken/ comeing off Dirty Sower head. turning the shower on in the morning sounded like T-Rex.  if it wasn't for the top two items listed i would rated a 4 stars. I Would deffently recommend my friends stay at this hotel. Carefull with the keys.

Summary Heading: Great Service from Veronika and clean rooms!
Summary: Our family stayed here for two nights. I'm a clean freak so I was pleased to see a real clean room.  Veronika at the front desk was nice and helpful. She was able to take care of all our needs and made sure we had a room close to the pool so that the kids would be well overseen.

Summary Heading: Didn't give us a room in the last minute
Summary: Came in. Received a room. Were suppose to stay two nights. Guy at the front desk messed up and said come back in the morning to get the next night played for. We agreed went to bed. In the morning they said they could no longer allow us to stay the following night due to a large party coming in...tell me how that's our fault? Now we have to look for another hotel.

Summary Heading: Great service from Veronika! Great price.
Summary: I booked online then i was checking in i was lucky to have Veronika help me. She helped make my stay a little more special!! Especially for my sick brother celebrating his 44Th and Last birthday!! Thanks for caring!Veronika is great!!

Summary Heading: My first stay at The Buena Park Hotel & Suites
Summary: I have stayed  at The Buena Park Hotel & Suites for one night on :9-7-2014. Pro's: -  it was conventionally located next the 91 Free way for easy access.  - The room was visually clean . - Bed was comfortable. - if you are looking for nice continental breakfast then you shall find it , I liked the waffles the most - since you guaranty its freshness by simply making then your self. - No loud voices or weird looking people. - it have a pool kids may enjoy. - Staff were helpful. - Internet worked. Cons: - not many TV channels. - Timer on the waffles machine did not work. - one rotten Orange was presented during breakfast. - Wall noise insulation are not the best as you could hear the neighbors. - Speed of the internet was around:1 MB. ( I measured it).

My boyfriend and I went to medieval times for the night. We were way to tired to drive home so we decided to stay at a hotel. He wanted cheap I want nice. Working at a 5 star hotel I'm very picking about my hotels and my boyfriends just cheap. When we walking into the lab of the hotel it didn't seem to disappont. They had a game room and gift shop. Carl was so helpful. He was nice enough to let us see the room. The rooms were so nice we had to stay. We both got what we wanted and slept like royalty. Lastly I would like to thank Carl for letting me use a charger for my phone.

WE chose this hotel based on price and reviews.  We originally booked one night but extended it for another. We liked that we could park our car outside our room.  The room was spacious and clean.  Breakfast was typical but sufficient.  We ate our breakfast out by the pool.  The staff were really friendly and approachable.  We enjoyed thee pool.  This is a great safe place.

We stayed at this hotel when we attended a wedding in this area. The hotel was easy to find as it was right off of the freeway.   Staff was friendly and the room was clean. The complimentary breakfast was good as well.   We had our dog with us and having him stay was no problem at all.   Easy access to Knotts Berry Farm, and the Pirate Adventure Dinner which is right across the street.   Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in a good location but as you drive in it appears run down.  The parking lot was dirty and someone was changing their oil in a parking stall.  The room was small and outdated.  The bathroom tub had a water leak all night.  You could hear the traffic and emergency sirens right outside your window the entire night.  Breakfast consisted of stale donuts and muffins and a waffle making machine.  If you want a very low budget stay without the frills at a low cost, this is the place to go. The front counter people were friendly and kind but the place was a dump!!!!

Alex at the front desk was great! The suite, room 236, was massive!! Loved it! Family friendly. Breakfast was a bit crowded but it was free.. So.. If we found ourselves in Buena Park again I would totally stay here again. I would recommend booking a suite.

Stayed in there newly renovated suites for only $68! Was within walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm and restaurants. Rooms were clean and the big kings beds were as soft as the pillows. Good value for your money here.

The Hotel has a good location. Near Knott Berry Farm and Disneyland. Also close to HW 5 and 91. We have stayed here many times during the years. Not bad at all, but this year we found it much better. Better service, better breakfast, increased poolarea and fresher rooms. We suppose as a reusult of the new management. We sure will be back!  Thanks! Peter Andersson with family

As we arrived there was a hooker leaving a room, There was hair in the bathtub,  no working phone, both ice machines were broken and when I asked the front desk what channels do they have for kids he told me " your asking the wrong person because I don't watch tv."

Summary Heading: I'm all about customer service and the front desk guy went above and beyond my expectations.
Summary: Rooms are huge and very nice. Idk what the others are complaining about. I got a 2 room suite for $107 out the door taxes n all and I would stay here every time I come to knotts from here on out. Very helpful and super easy check in and again rooms are huge and worth every dollar. I'm a Marriott person but I don't like spending 300+ $ for one night and this place is awesome!

The cleanliness of the room was fine - had big comfortable beds, fridge, microwave. TV screen was too small for kids to play games on. Bathroom tub faucet ran constantly. Breakfast average, waffles, no meats or fruit.  Maybe it's unfair to blame the hotel, but when we were at the pool, a family, presumably from the ghetto, came in, no swimsuits, just underwear, and one kid pulled down his pants, whipped it out, and peed both in the pool and on his sister. The mom just laughed. Just wondering if this is standard clientele for the hotel.

Within a short walk to knott's berry farm.  Outback steak house next door. Target a couple block away.  Waffles and donuts for the free breakfast.  Nice staff.  Accepted our pet.  Pool was kind of small and not too deep.  Overall good value if you want to be close to the park.  No fridge in the room.  A little dated but it worked for us.  No shuttle to the airport.  We had to pay 15 dollar each for a shuttle.

Summary Heading: Nice staff but serious maintenance issues.
Summary: Three rooms with odor, broken drawers, leaky faucets.  Fourth room better but not right, mold in tub and greasy footprint in tub.  Outdoor Jacuzzi was brown.  On the bright side staff were helpful and pleasant and the breakfast was nice.  Should get more waffle irons but plenty of donuts coffee and cereal to eat.

July 4th weekend family trip, stay there total of 5 rooms for 3 nights. Newly remodeled rooms, nice and clean, friendly services. Wonderful place to stay. We love it and will recommend to all friends.

We got a great price on the Deluxe Family Suite that was "newly renovated".  The exterior is severely outdated, the newly renovated room had many issues.  The exterior door frame was cracked from being kicked in and painted over, old furniture, old tube TV, wall air conditioner in second room was literally from the 1970's and in terrible shape, hairs in the bathroom and shower, phone buttons were so sticky that they hardly pushed down and the phone line was cut at the wall jack.  The only new that we saw was the coat of paint, new sink and counter top and new toilet, that was it.  We had booked for 10 nights but checked out after 1 somewhat sleepless night.  Did receive a refund for the entire amount including the night we stayed, front desk clerk was very friendly and

I went to this place on the 4th of july this place was so ugly the pool was nasty and dirty doesn't even look like they clean that pool ever I went to get ice and there was no ice at all in the machine the room was ugly the tv was a big box tv spray painted green on it only like 9 channels on it no cable no mini frige like they were suposed to have I got a rash on my hands from the hand soap they give u not enough at all I will never come back to this place again this place sucks

I rented our several rooms for 5 nights back to back. I needed a hotel that would be accommodating and close to the venues of my daughter's wedding. I rented rooms for my family and friends who also enjoyed their stay there. Kirt, the manager whom we booked the the rooms through, was very helpful and generous. Kirt was able to accommodate us with requests that were under his control, which made our stay enjoyable. During our stay, we were also provided a breakfast/lunch/dinner room to feed our guests. Kirt also provided American breakfast, in which we were very grateful to have. We were very grateful to have Buena Park Hotel & Suites be a part of my daughter's day.  The rooms that I, and most of our guests stayed in were satisfactory and comfortable. If an issue arose, one of

Summary Heading: Horrible.. Would never stay there again.
Summary: Room was outdated . shower had some kind of layer over layer like someone had fell thru..it was just horrible .I thought because of the ratings and high trip advisor that this was a nice place .Don't be fooled ..And I would never stay there again. Breakfast was a bust.Room was nasty and musty.Don't waste your money spend the extra 20 to 40 dollars a night and go somewhere else.

had a great time staying at this hotel rooms are very clean,staff was very nice would love to say this is a very nice place to stay with kids.the Breakfeast is great and the rooms are very clean. service was great as well.

The hotel is in perfect location. reachable around point of interests.rooms were kinda outdated but all worth for the value. had a sound sleep.front desk guy was accommodating to all our needs in the room.

EXCELLENT value. For how cheap our room was I thought for sure it was going to have something terribly wrong with it, but since we are on a budget I was prepared anyway. The people are friendly it's quiet which is surprising for st Patrick's day on spring break. My six year old went straight to sleep.The pool is beautiful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Theres breakfast! This motel deserves more than 2 stars. The only thing that I was even a hint unhappy about was that the hot tub wasn't quite hot enough. It was more like a warm bath. I've paid more for much worse than this. Smiling

I wish I could give this hotel negative circles. Stayed one night here and it was aweful. We could hear everything. Water running in another room, vibrations from people walking, people talking and playing music, and next door a person was snoring. We can hear the vacuum being used in the room next door as I type this and it sounds like it's being used in this room! Very thin walls. I have very sensitive allergies so I think there was mold in the bathroom because I was very congested. Carpet was VERY dirty. There was a staple on the floor and pieces of trash scattered everywhere.  Bathroom light is so dim too! The remote control had tape on the back to hold the batteries. Pillows were awful and the beds are uncomfortable.  Overall this hotel visit was very poor.

Summary Heading: We thought we were staying I'm a hotel but we got a Motel.
Summary: We were shocked at the condition of this place mainly because of the location. We made the mistake of assuming that, just because it's close to a well populated, live place that there weren't any cheap motels in the area. I should've known something was up when we got the amazing price. This just proves that you really get what you pay for. There's really no difference then this place and a Motel 6.
