What really got me mad was I can totally see underneath the front door. The gap is big enough for rats to come and go ad they please. I'm not comfortable with that. Unfortunately I made reservations for 2 nights. I'm considering taking the lose and just go to a better place. Very very very disappointed.

This Hotel is not for everyone as it is getting a bit old and the rooms do need an upgrade. The carpet is full of stains, the doors are a bit crooked with cracks and several other items which spoiled people would not like. The good part is that the price is very reasonable, the rooms are fairly quite as are the entire premises, you can drive right up and park your car  outside of your hotel room door and walk right in. The people at the front desk and the maids are fast, friendly and efficient. This hotel is fine for a few nights stay at reasonable prices.

The Gm Esther Lin And front desk Manager rachele are the greatest and the top in the fields when i had my heart attack at the hotel in the middel of the night and steped in and had taken care of my family while i was in the hospital would i recommed this hotel oh yes i would all the staff be outstanding they are the best the beat any hotel that i have stayed at we will stay here every chance we get Shannon and Mike

Not a luxury hotel but very good value for Anaheim/Buena Park area.  Rooms are clean, service is very friendly (the service desk clerk when I checked in really late was especially nice), and breakfast is more than what other similar hotels are offering. Location is awesome, too. Just off the freeways and very near Knotts Berry Farm and a just a few miles from Disneyland.

We booked the motel because it was close to Knott's Berry Farm and within 10 minutes to Disneyland. The place was relatively clean and access to room was using an USB (cool!) rather than key or card. The room was however still outdated, still has tube TV's but the room came with refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, and hair dryer. Bathroom was clean but the fan was very noisy. We stayed for three days in July 2013 and we will probably come back if the price remains reasonable. They did have continental breakfast which was plus...I think the service was not the best..Overall the place is average at best..If only want to stay at a reasonable price to sleep and venture out for activities, then this is a place for you.

Summary Heading: STILL the best value in town!
Summary: We last came here in April of 2011, and for us, nothing has changed :).  The location is perfect...it's right off the freeway and a few blocks up from Knott's. The staff is very friendly (Rachel's still there) and extremely accommodating. The hotel’s manager (Juan or Jose?) is simply the best.  We stayed for one night, 6/29, since that's all we needed. Our plan is always the same: the husband, little one and I drive up from SD early on Saturday, park at the hotel (letting them know we're there) in time to walk to Knott's Berry Farm when they open at 10, play for a while, then walk back for the 3:00 check-in and rest for a couple of hours before going back until closing time. Then we walk back the final time and hit the hay until heading back to SD the next morning. It's pretty

I went to the maid service and asked for 4 towels. The guy didn't speak any English. I asked him for 4 towels he gave me 2, then i told him 2 more and he gave me one more, then i said one more and then he gave me one more. Then I asked for a hand towel and he gave me 2 wash cloths. At that point i gave up and took my 4 towels and 2 wash cloths to my room. I put 2 towels on the shelf in the bathroom and hung up the other 2 right below the shelf. No long after that we left to go to the Pirate Dinner Adventure. When we returned later that evening, I notice that there was a hand towel on the bathroom
Manager Response: Dear ckick002,  Thank you for your response. I do Apologize for the inconvinence. Please rest assured that we take all of our guests privacy very seriously. Our staff will not enter the room, if the Do not Disturb sign is hanging on the door. The only time our staff will enter a  guest  room is for a delivery or service request with permission of the guest. We are in the process of upgrading our TV's to Flat Screens. We shampoo our carpets monthly. once again Thank you for your response . Please send your email to john@thebuenaparkhotel.com so I can properly address the your concerns.  Sincerely, J.Guerrero

Summary: We stayed on 4/13-4/14/13 due mainly to the hotel's proximity to Knott's Berry Farm.Let me list the reasons as to why I gave the property one star:  - We checked in after 4:00pm though upon arriving to the room, a maid's cart was propping the door open. There were a male and female housekeeper in the room - talking, not working, and they looked surprised when I held up the key and indicated it was my room. The male simply said, "Everything works!" and laughed as they walked out.  - Not only are the sheets not fitted, as another reviewer indicated, but there was a large hole in the blanket on the bed (about the size of a silver dollar).  - We were placed in a room immediately next to a stairwell. The walls are so thin, we heard anyone who used the stairwell. We literally only

We stayed here 3/25-3/27/13. If this motel were renovated from the lobby to the rooms, it would be 5 stars (but then of course they would probably charge more per night). Continental breakfast was included but we never got to eat because the lines to heat up the waffles were not worth the wait. Didn't utilize Wi-Fi because they charged a $10.00 deposit so I just used my wireless phone for internet needs. Our room was on the corner of the 2nd floor facing the 91 offramp, so there was traffic noise however I'm use to it and also the a/c and tv both helped to drown out the outside noise.We didn't utilize the pool because we were gone all day. There's a small arcade on the second floor of the lobby and the breakfast area is pretty large. There's also a small gift shop in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear currypuff2,  Thank you for your review  & we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, J.Guerrero

Summary Heading: Good location, rooms a little run down
Summary: I stayed at this Hotel. It is really a motel on March 7th for two nights. I checked in around 2pm. The clerk was pretty friendly. He stated they were going to be full, but the parking lot was pretty empty and I did not see many people around. It may be due to people being at the parks or not have checked in yet.  I asked for a room with a refrigerator. He stated that he was not sure because they were full and I would have to check out the room first. I went to the room, which ended up being in the back, far away from the rest of the hotel. The room was upstairs. I walk in and they have a refrigerator and microwave, couch (fold out) and king size bed. The room had been broken into. The whole door jam was cracked through and was screwed back in. The molding around the door jam had
Manager Response: Dear Alan R,  Thank you for your review & sharing your concerns with us. I will address all concerns that you have shared with us. I do greatly appreciate bringing the broken door jam to our attention & i want to assure we have  since replaced the door jam. Our property does host several Bus Tours so our property fills up quickly. Our gameroom has several arcade games, a pool table , & several entertainment machines. We will be make improvements in the near future & have also added to our complimentary Continental Breakfast. We hope you would consider staying with us in the future. & thank you for your review.   Sincerely, J.Guerrero

Summary: I stayed here in March of 2013. Overall it's not a bad hotel. It's inexpensive and close to everything. My only problem was that the beds did not have fitted sheets. As you would sleep the sheets would come off the mattress and you would wake up sleeping on a bare mattress. I would stay again for sure if they get fitted sheets.
Manager Response: Dear Erich H,  Thank you for your review & sharing your concerns with us.  We do greatly appreciate your suggestions to better your stay with us. We take all suggestions into consideration so that we provide better service for all our guests.  Thank you! We look forward to your next stay with us.  Sincerely, J. Guerrero

Summary: We stayed over Christmas week 2012; our room was nice but noise was a problem sometimes.  Overall it was a good place to stay in the few hours we weren't at Disneyland, but it could use some improvements.  Good for budget travel, but nothing special. Pros: clean rooms; responsive staff; mid-speed (not high but not low) wifi was available in our room, (even though a handout given at check-in said you need cat-5 cable to use wired internet), but sometimes it took some time to reconnect the next few days I used it; fridge; microwave; iron & board; hair dryer all worked.  Coffee maker there but didn't use.  Good access to freeway. Cons: CRT TVs with only 15 channels (no ESPN, HBO, Showtime); towels were thin and small; walls are thin with sounds from all directions, sometimes
Manager Response: Dear Brett G,  Thank you for review & sharing your concerns with us. So that we may improve our service.  We have been making several improvements to our property. We will be upgrading our  Televisons Soon. We will also be adding  a few more items to Our Complimentary Continental. Breakfast to include an additional cereal & other pastry items. We do hope you book with us in the future to see the improvements we have made so far.   Sincerely, J.Guerrero

Summary: Older and not as nice as the Courtyard by Marriott just down the street. But worth the $60 we paid for a room near the pool. The breakfast was above average. Both of us liked the waffles that you ran through the toaster. They came out hot and tasty.   We were on a ground floor and from a security standpoint probably not the best place. There was no way to open the window a little ways and then lock it so it couldn't be opened further. We chose to keep the window closed. The bed was comfortable. Glad that we always bring our own pillows. We tossed the hotel pillows to the side. The room had a refrigerator.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, better than expected.
Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2012. The location was perfect with Knotts, Pirates, Medieval Times, and numerous places to eat being within walking distance. The price was awesome and because it was so cheap we thought it might rate only fair; we were pleasantly suprised! The rooms were clean and kept and the facilities in good shape including swimming pool. Every staff member I had contact with was pleasant and helpful, especially the lady concierge who had price saving coupons for area attractions and John Guerrero at the front desk. The included breakfast also saved us some money. I would recommend this hotel to family and will stay here again.

Good value for your money.  John Guerrero, the manager, provided us with excellent service.  He accomodated all of our special requests, such as room location, refrigerator, microwave, etc.  He was very nice and polite, he never rushed through his answers to our many questions.  He spent the extra time to answer them completely and didn't make you feel like it was a bother.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was good, waffles, cereal, fruit, bread, doughnuts/muffins.  Close to Knotts Berry Farm.  Definitely would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location (And thats about all)
Summary: This hotel is located directly across from the Pirate Show, and about one block from Medieval Times.  It cost half as much as the other hotel in the same area.  The staff were relatively friendly, and the pool & spa were nice.  That said, the rooms were on the dirtier side (mold on the walls, lots of broken knobs & appliances, beds that needed to be replaced years ago, etc.)  We waited well past check-in and never received the two side-by-side rooms we were promised.  Housekeeping was rude.  But for the price and location, we'd probably stay there again.

Stayed here 3 nights in April. Very clean and quiet. Staff was friendly and courteous. Continental breakfast was good but get up before eight if you want to eat as it goes fast. Very close to Knotts Berry Farm and Medieval Times and not far from Disneyland. Close to the freeway.Refrigerator didn't get cold until the night before we left but lots of free ice from the machine and we were OK. Great to have a microwave and if you forgot anything at home Target and Walmart as well as other stores are all less than a mile away.The Walmart is attached to a small mall.I have stayed at hotels 3 times the price but for $59.00 a night this was a good find. I will stay here again.
